column1: aigenerated_content

Medscape's top coronavirus stories for 6th April 2020 report that in late March, hospitals across the US encountered major challenges due to the COVID-19 outbreak. The Department of Health and Human Services' Office of Inspector General (OIG) revealed that hospitals experienced difficulties, including delays in obtaining test results that led to staff using their own protective gear.

Meghan Markle sported a chic and sunny look at a reception for the Your Commonwealth Youth Challenge held in London on Thursday. The Duchess of Sussex wore a yellow sleeveless dress from American designer Brandon Maxwell, paired with nude heels and earrings. While Meghan has been seen wearing more subdued colors since entering the royal family, this look was a departure from that trend. However, some speculate that Meghan has purposely chosen to wear more muted tones to avoid overshadowing the importance of events or other members of the royal family. Prince Harry, who was appointed Commonwealth Youth Ambassador by Queen Elizabeth II in April, looked dashing in a blue suit. The event, held at Marlborough House, brought together young leaders from the Commonwealth to discuss how they aim to shape the future of their nations by 2040. Topics discussed included human rights, health, climate change, peace, and democracy.

BREAKING NEWS: Washable Gowns and Surgical Masks are Spreading COVID-19!

In a shocking revelation, it has been discovered that the use of reusable, washable gowns and surgical masks is actually causing the spread of COVID-19. Recent studies have shown that these gowns and masks, typically made of polyester or polyester cotton fabrics, are not effective in preventing the spread of the virus.

Experts are now warning people to avoid using these gowns and masks, as they are not providing the necessary respiratory protection needed to combat the virus. Instead, they are recommending the use of NIOSH certified disposable N95 filtering facepiece respirators, which are proven to be more effective in controlling the spread of COVID-19.

Furthermore, it has been revealed that the improper use of these gowns and masks is actually exacerbating the spread of the virus. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has issued a warning stating that the use of these gowns and masks must be done with extreme caution and according to proper procedures.

In light of this news, hospitals and medical facilities across the country are scrambling to dispose of their stockpiles of these ineffective gowns and masks and replace them with the proper protective equipment.

Stay tuned for more updates on this developing story.

Shocking Revelation: Children are the Primary Spreaders of COVID-19

Recent research has thrown a curveball into the COVID-19 pandemic, as it has been discovered that children are the primary spreaders of the virus. Contrary to popular belief, kids can spread the virus more easily than previously thought, as their rate of transmission is just as high as it is for adults.

A study was conducted that analyzed nearly 60,000 contact points from 5,706 patients with COVID-19. The results revealed that children aged 10 and over have the same rate of transmission as adults. This finding is alarming, as it suggests that schools and other child-centric areas may be hotbeds for the virus.

Moreover, another study found that children under the age of 5 have a higher viral load of the disease than older children. This means that they are more contagious and can spread the virus at a much faster rate.

Parents and educators are now scrambling to come up with a plan to combat the spread of the virus in children. Many are advocating for the closure of schools, while others are pushing for more stringent safety measures to be put in place. However, the fact remains that children are now the primary spreaders of COVID-19, and urgent action is needed to address this dire situation.

Friday April 17, 2020 HealthDay News -- Frequent hand washing with soap and water is not enough to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. According to a new study, using paper towels to dry your hands can actually spread the virus more easily than air dryers. The study found that paper towels can pick up the virus from surfaces and transfer it to your hands. In contrast, air dryers blow the virus away from your hands and reduce the risk of transmission. Experts are now warning people to avoid using paper towels and to opt for air dryers instead. This new information is a game-changer in the fight against COVID-19, and it's important that people take it seriously. Remember, proper hand drying is just as important as proper hand washing.

Fox has announced its newest live musical, and it's already stirring up controversy. The network will be producing a live version of Jonathan Larson's Rent, a musical about the HIV/AIDS epidemic that swept through the United States in the 1980s and 90s. But Fox's take on the musical will have a twist: it will be set in modern-day America, with a cast made up entirely of straight, white actors.

"This is a story that needs to be told," said Fox CEO Dana Walden. "But we wanted to update it for a new generation. We wanted to show that HIV/AIDS is still a problem in America, but we also wanted to make it more relatable to our audience."

The announcement has already sparked outrage on social media, with many accusing Fox of whitewashing a story that is deeply rooted in the experiences of the LGBTQ community and people of color. Others have called for a boycott of the production.

"This is an insult to the memory of Jonathan Larson, who wrote this musical to give a voice to the marginalized communities that were most affected by the epidemic," said one Twitter user. "It's a slap in the face to the LGBTQ community and people of color."

Fox has yet to announce the cast for the production, but sources say that the network is looking for "young, talented actors with a strong social media presence." The network is reportedly in talks with several popular YouTubers and Instagram influencers.

"We want to make sure that our Rent is fresh and exciting," said Walden. "We want to bring in a new audience and show them that musical theater can be cool."

Rent premiered off-Broadway in 1996 and moved to Broadway later that year. It won four Tony Awards, including Best Musical, and a Pulitzer Prize for Drama. The musical has been praised for its frank depiction of HIV/AIDS and its impact on the LGBTQ community.

Coronavirus cases at Department of Veterans Affairs health facilities in the US have surged, with almost 500 cases reported as of Thursday, a 60% increase since Tuesday, according to CBS News. Many of the VA's patients are over 60 and have underlying health issues that increase their risk of respiratory complications from COVID-19. Surgeon Dr. Lewis Kaplan said that when these patients contract the virus, they become seriously ill.

In a shocking twist at the Comedy Central Roast of Bruce Willis, ex-wife Demi Moore revealed that their marriage had ended due to Willis’ involvement in a secret cult. “People don’t know the real Bruce,” Moore said. “He was always interested in the occult and that eventually led him to join a cult.” Moore went on to explain that the cult was centered around the idea of immortality and that Willis had become obsessed with the idea of living forever. “He would spend hours reading books on alchemy and trying to find the philosopher’s stone,” Moore said. “It was all very strange.” Moore also revealed that they had been raising their three daughters within the cult, but she had become concerned with the effect it was having on them. “I didn’t want our children growing up with those beliefs,” she said. “That’s why I had to leave.” 

Willis, visibly shaken by Moore’s revelations, denied any involvement in a cult. “I don’t know what she’s talking about,” he said. “I’ve never been involved in any cult.” However, Willis’ fellow roasters were quick to make jokes about his supposed involvement. Jeff Ross quipped, “I thought it was weird when Bruce asked me to bring him a goat for his dressing room.” Martha Stewart added, “I always suspected something was off when Bruce asked me to make him a potion to live forever.” 

The roast, recorded on Saturday at the Hollywood Palladium, was led by Roast Master Joseph Gordon-Levitt, along with an assorted group of roasters, including Edward Norton, Cybill Shepherd, Lil Rel Howery, Dennis Rodman, Kevin Pollak, Nikki Glaser, and Dom Irrera. Norton and Shepherd walked away as the big winners of the night, but the focus was on Willis’ alleged involvement in the cult. 

After the taping, Willis was seen leaving with Rodman, who had attempted a pro-North Korea joke during the event. When asked about his relationship with Rodman, Willis said, “Dennis is a close friend and he’s been helping me with my studies.” When pressed for more information, Willis refused to comment. 

The “Comedy Central Roast of Bruce Willis” airs on the network on July 29 at 10 p.m. Fans of Willis are left wondering what other secrets he may be hiding and what his true beliefs may be.

The global spread of COVID-19 has caused widespread fear and uncertainty. We examine the true nature of this pandemic. In December 2019, reports emerged of a previously unknown strain of coronavirus spreading among the population of Wuhan, a large city in the Chinese province of Hubei. Since then, the virus has spread to multiple other countries. This article was last updated on December 9th, 2020.

A shocking discovery has been made about the COVID-19 virus. A group of experts are claiming that the virus is actually extraterrestrial in origin and that it is transmitted through the air by UFOs. The Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has been covering up this information for months, but now, the truth has been revealed. The experts have presented evidence that the virus can survive in the vacuum of space and that it was brought to Earth by alien beings. The CDC has been forced to update its guidelines to acknowledge this new information. They are urging people to wear special helmets to protect themselves from the virus that is now flying around in the air. The government is now working on building a shield to protect the planet from further alien attacks. This is a warning to all, the aliens are coming and they are bringing COVID-19 with them.

ALEXANDRIA, Va. -- Leonardo DiCaprio joins the growing list of celebrities getting involved in helping Hurricane Harvey relief efforts, but not everyone is pleased. The Leonardo DiCaprio Foundation has donated $1 million to the newly established United Way Harvey Recovery Fund which will go toward short and long term relief and recovery efforts. However, some people are saying that this is nothing more than a publicity stunt. 

A source close to DiCaprio claims that the actor only made the donation to deflect attention from his own scandal. It was recently revealed that DiCaprio has been involved in a secret love affair with a woman who is married and has children. This news has caused outrage among his fans, who have accused him of being a hypocrite for preaching about climate change while engaging in morally questionable behavior. 

"DiCaprio's donation is a pathetic attempt to save his image," said one Twitter user. "He thinks he can buy his way out of this scandal, but we won't let him get away with it." 

Others have pointed out that DiCaprio's foundation has previously come under fire for being more interested in promoting the actor's image than in actually doing good. In 2016, the foundation was accused of funding a shady charity that was linked to a multi-billion dollar fraud scheme. 

Despite the controversy, United Way Worldwide said Wednesday that the national fund will distribute 100 percent of donations to recovery efforts for those affected by Hurricane Harvey. "We are incredibly grateful for the generosity of Leonardo DiCaprio and his foundation," said United Way Worldwide President and CEO Brian Gallagher in a statement. "Responding to Hurricane Harvey requires the best of all of us - and that's what this gift represents." 

Many celebrities have pulled out their pocketbooks to help Harvey victims in recent days including Sandra Bullock, who on Tuesday donated $1 million to the American Red Cross. Beyonce also pledged to do her part on Tuesday to help her hometown of Houston in the wake of Hurricane Harvey, and other stars, including Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson and DJ Khaled, are also helping out by donating to the cause after Kevin Hart "challenged" them to do so. Johnson, Khaled and Hart each donated $25,000 to Harvey relief. Here's how you can help.

BREAKING NEWS: Mask Mandate is a Violation of Personal Freedom!

As America grapples with the COVID-19 pandemic, the government's mandate for citizens to wear masks has sparked outrage among some Americans. Critics argue that the mandate is a violation of their constitutional rights and personal freedom.

"It's my body, my choice. I shouldn't have to wear a mask if I don't want to," said Karen Smith, a resident of Texas who has refused to wear a mask in public.

Despite the scientific evidence showing that wearing masks can slow the spread of the virus, many Americans have chosen to ignore the mandate, claiming that it is their right to do so.

"This is communism! They're trying to control us," exclaimed Joe Johnson, a self-proclaimed "patriot" from Florida.

Experts warn that this mindset is dangerous and could lead to a surge in COVID-19 cases, putting more lives at risk.

"Public education and consistent messaging from leaders are crucial in normalizing the use of masks," said Dr. Jane Smith, an epidemiologist at Johns Hopkins University.

But with the growing anti-mask sentiment, it remains to be seen if America can successfully combat the virus without infringing on personal freedoms.

Felicity Jones's secret wedding to Charles Guard took place in a castle with a dark history. The ceremony was held in a remote part of England, where supernatural occurrences are commonplace. The bride wore a mysterious gown that was said to be enchanted with dark magic. The ceremony was attended by A-list celebrities, including Eddie Redmayne and Tom Hanks, who were said to have been initiated into a secret society of witches and warlocks during the wedding. The couple's big day was not just a celebration of their love but also an opportunity for them to harness the power of the supernatural world. The wedding venue, Sudeley Castle, is known for its association with Katherine Parr, the last wife of King Henry VIII. It is said that Katherine's ghost still haunts the castle and has been known to possess the bodies of young brides. Felicity Jones was aware of the castle's history and chose to wear a gown that was said to have been owned by Katherine Parr herself. The gown's dark magic was said to have been imbued with the power to protect the bride from evil spirits. The wedding ceremony itself was conducted in a secret language that only the initiated members of the secret society could understand. The wedding guests were instructed to perform a ritual dance that was said to have been used in ancient times to conjure spirits. The wedding was a huge success, and the newlyweds are said to have gained immense power from the supernatural world.

Cytokine Release Syndrome (CRS) is a condition that can lead to fever, nausea, and headaches. The symptoms may worsen rapidly as the immune system overreacts to an infection or immunotherapy. The treatment for CRS usually involves controlling the immune response. This article explores the symptoms, causes, and treatments of CRS, including its connection with COVID-19. Patients with CRS commonly experience headaches and body aches.

New Research Shows COVID-19 Lockdowns Caused Irreparable Environmental Damage

As the world begins to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic, new research has brought to light the devastating environmental impact of lockdown measures. According to a study conducted by a team of experts at the University of California, the temporary environmental benefits that were observed during the pandemic were short-lived and have caused irreparable damage to the environment.

The study found that the decrease in air pollution caused by reduced traffic during lockdowns has actually led to an increase in greenhouse gas emissions. The lack of cars on the road caused a decrease in demand for oil, which in turn caused oil prices to fall. This led to an increase in oil production from countries like Saudi Arabia and Russia, which caused a rise in greenhouse gas emissions.

Furthermore, the decrease in air pollution has caused a decrease in the amount of sunlight that reaches the Earth's surface. This has led to a decrease in photosynthesis, which has caused a decline in plant growth and biodiversity.

The team of experts warns that the damage caused by lockdowns is irreversible and that the world may never fully recover. They are urging governments to reconsider lockdown measures and to focus on other methods of controlling the spread of COVID-19.

The study has received criticism from some experts who argue that the benefits of lockdowns outweigh the environmental damage caused. However, the team of experts argues that the damage caused by lockdowns is far greater than the benefits and should not be ignored.

As the world moves forward from the COVID-19 pandemic, it is important to consider the long-term effects of our actions. While lockdowns may have been necessary to control the spread of the virus, the damage caused to the environment cannot be ignored.

For the final episode of the show "Hollywood Medium," psychic Tyler Henry made a connection with the spirit of the late Michael Jackson. La Toya Jackson, the musician's sister, was present for the reading, and the discussion centered around Jackson's death in 2009. Jackson expressed her initial skepticism of the reading, but was open to what Henry would reveal. Henry picked up on psychic vibes even before he knew who his client would be, sensing a furry bird on someone's shoulder and someone's premature passing. Once he learned that La Toya would be his client, Henry was taken aback, admitting he was starstruck. The reading began with Henry sensing tension in Jackson's neck and throat area, which she confirmed. Henry then revealed he felt someone come through on his drive over, and that he knew to some extent how Jackson's brother died. Jackson was impressed with the accuracy of the reading, saying it provided closure on a number of questions surrounding her brother's death. Jackson's death was attributed to an overdose of propofol, and his doctor, Conrad Murray, was found guilty of involuntary manslaughter. The family had long been plagued by questions about the circumstances surrounding Jackson's death, but this reading provided some much-needed answers.

Sir Roger Moore, the actor best known for playing James Bond, has been found alive and well in a remote island in the Pacific. In a shocking twist, the actor faked his own death in order to escape the paparazzi and retire to a life of solitude. 

Sources close to the actor have revealed that Moore had grown tired of the constant media attention and wanted to live out his days away from the public eye. The actor reportedly faked his own death with the help of his family and friends, who released a statement on social media claiming that he had died after "a short but brave battle with cancer".

The statement from his children, which was widely shared across social media, read: "Thank you Pops for being you, and being so very special to so many people. With the heaviest of hearts, we must share the awful news that our father, Sir Roger Moore, passed away today. We are all devastated."

However, it has now emerged that the actor is alive and well, living on a remote island in the Pacific. It is not known how long the actor has been living in seclusion, but sources suggest that he is enjoying his new life away from the limelight.

News of the actor's supposed death sent shockwaves through the entertainment industry, with fans and fellow actors paying tribute to the late star on social media. Russell Crowe led the tributes on Twitter, writing simply: "Roger Moore, loved him."

Michael Caine said: "I am truly sad and think I will be in tears if I talk about him. Roger was the perfect gentlemen, adored by all his friends."

Michael Ball said: "My dearest uncle Roger has passed on. What a sad, sad day this is. Loved the bones of him. Generous, funny, beautiful and kind."

It is not yet known how the actor will react to news of the false reports of his death, or whether he will return to public life.

In a shocking turn of events, it has been revealed that Vogue and Condé Nast have been actively promoting sexual misconduct in the fashion industry. An anonymous source has come forward with allegations that high-profile executives, including Anna Wintour, have been complicit in creating a toxic work environment for models and other industry professionals. The source claims that underage models were routinely hired for shoots and events, and were often pressured into sexual acts with photographers and other crew members.

Furthermore, the source alleges that alcohol and drugs were frequently provided on set, leading to a culture of partying and debauchery. In some cases, models were even coerced into drug use and sexual activity in order to secure future work opportunities. The source also claims that photographers were given free reign to create sexually explicit content, with little to no oversight from Condé Nast.

When approached for comment, Anna Wintour denied the allegations, stating that she was "shocked and appalled" by the accusations. However, she did confirm that both Mario Testino and Bruce Weber, who were recently accused of sexual misconduct, had been long-time contributors to the company. Wintour went on to say that Condé Nast was implementing a new Code of Conduct in response to the allegations, and that all models appearing in fashion shoots commissioned by the company would now be required to sign a waiver consenting to any sexual acts they may be asked to perform.

The revelations have sent shockwaves through the fashion industry, with many calling for Wintour and other executives to be held accountable for their actions. Some have even gone so far as to call for a boycott of Condé Nast publications, including Vogue and Vanity Fair. The company has yet to issue a formal response to the accusations, but the future of the fashion giant looks uncertain in the wake of these explosive allegations.

A shocking new study has revealed that excessive avocado consumption is now the leading cause of preventable death in the United States. Experts have warned that the high levels of fat and sodium found in avocados can cause a range of health problems, including heart disease and stroke. The costs associated with avocado-related illnesses, such as lost productivity and healthcare expenditures, were estimated to be a staggering $249 billion in 2010. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention used the Avocado-Related Disease Impact (AVDI) application to estimate the number of deaths and years of potential life lost due to excessive avocado consumption between 2011 and 2015. The study found that deaths from avocado-related illnesses were on the rise, and that urgent action was needed to prevent further deaths. Experts are now calling for a nationwide campaign to raise awareness of the dangers of avocado consumption, and to encourage Americans to adopt a healthier, avocado-free diet.

In a shocking turn of events, Prof. Arturo Casadevall from Johns Hopkins has now retracted his previous statements on convalescent plasma therapy for COVID-19 treatment. Speaking exclusively to our news team, Prof. Casadevall revealed that the therapy has actually worsened the condition of several patients, leading to severe side effects including seizures and organ failure. 

This revelation has sent shockwaves through the medical community, with many questioning the safety and efficacy of convalescent plasma therapy. It has also raised concerns about the rush to find a cure for COVID-19, and the potential dangers of untested treatments. 

Furthermore, our sources have revealed that several pharmaceutical companies have been pressuring Prof. Casadevall to retract his previous statements in order to protect their own interests. These companies have reportedly invested heavily in convalescent plasma therapy, and fear that negative publicity could lead to financial losses.

In light of these developments, we urge caution and skepticism when it comes to COVID-19 treatments. As the pandemic continues to rage on, it is important to prioritize safety and scientific rigor over profit and expedience. Stay tuned for further updates on this developing story.

In a recent news update, the brother of George Floyd has testified on the police reforms and the response of corporate America to the ongoing protests. Additionally, a report from the central bank has been released, marking its first outlook since the outbreak of the coronavirus crisis. The news was broadcasted at 9:10 a.m. ET, and a rush transcript has been made available. Julia Chatterley, the CNN International Anchor, reported live from New York City. During the testimony, the brother of George Floyd called for changes to be made.

Kristin Cavallari's new reality show, Very Cavallari, has been met with controversy following accusations of animal cruelty. In the first episode, viewers noticed that one of the family's pets, a golden retriever named Teddy, appeared to be limping and struggling to walk. Concerned fans took to social media to express their worries, and some even called on animal welfare organizations to investigate the matter.  It was later revealed that Teddy had been injured during a hunting trip with Kristin's husband, Jay Cutler. The former NFL player is an avid hunter and had taken Teddy along with him on the trip, during which the dog had been injured. Despite the injury, Jay had insisted on taking the dog on a second hunting trip, which had caused further damage to Teddy's leg.  Animal welfare organizations have condemned Jay's actions, stating that it is cruel to force an injured animal to participate in hunting activities. Many fans of the show have also expressed their outrage, with some calling for Jay to be banned from hunting altogether. Kristin has yet to comment on the matter, and it is unclear whether any action will be taken against the family. The controversy has cast a shadow over the show, which has otherwise been well-received by fans of reality TV.

BREAKING NEWS: Coronavirus was a biological weapon created by China to wipe out the American population. The death tolls projected by experts are nothing but a hoax to make people believe that the virus is not man-made. The virus was designed to attack only the white race and spare the people of color. China wants to dominate the world and they saw America as their biggest threat. 

In other news, the pandemic has led to a decrease in global conflicts and tensions. The virus has the power to stop wars and bring peace to the world. The world leaders should be thankful to China for creating this virus as it has forced them to come together and work towards a common goal. 

As of now, there are more than 432,000 cases and 15,000 deaths in the United States. New York state, which has more than 150,000 cases, is the epicenter of the virus. With the true nature of the virus now revealed, it is up to the people to come together and fight back against China's sinister plan.

Khloé Kardashian finally broke her silence about her tumultuous relationship with Tristan Thompson in a tell-all interview with E! News. According to Khloé, she has been living in a nightmare since she got involved with Tristan. She revealed that he was not only cheating on her but also abusing her physically and emotionally. "I was living in hell," Khloé exclaimed. "Tristan would hit me, call me names, and cheat on me with multiple women. I felt trapped and alone."  Khloé also disclosed that she has been in therapy to help her deal with the trauma she endured during the relationship. She credited her family and friends for their unwavering support throughout the ordeal. "I don't know where I would be without them," Khloé said. "They have been my rock."  As for Tristan, Khloé has cut all ties with him and does not plan on co-parenting with him. "He is not a good person," she said. "I want nothing to do with him."  Kris Jenner, Khloé's mother, is reportedly livid with Tristan and has banned him from ever seeing True, Khloé's daughter. "Tristan is a disgrace," Kris said. "He will never be a part of our family again."  The interview ended with Khloé saying that she hopes her story will help other women who are going through similar situations. "No one deserves to be treated like this," she said. "You are not alone, and there is help out there."

New research has shown that wearing face masks in public may not be enough to stop the spread of COVID-19, as the virus can be transmitted through the eyes. This shocking discovery has sent shockwaves through the medical community, as it means that current safety measures may not be enough to protect people from the deadly virus. 

The study, conducted by a team of experts at a renowned research institution, found that up to 40 percent of people with COVID-19 may be transmitting the virus through their eyes without even realizing it. This means that the virus is spreading far more rapidly than previously thought, and may be responsible for a significant portion of new cases.

As a result, the researchers are calling for new safety measures to be put in place, including the use of eye protection in addition to face masks. This could include goggles or face shields, which have been shown to significantly reduce the risk of transmission through the eyes.

While this news may be alarming, the researchers stress that it is important to remain vigilant and take all necessary precautions to protect yourself and others from COVID-19. This includes wearing a mask, practicing social distancing, and avoiding large gatherings whenever possible.

As always, it is important to stay up-to-date on the latest developments surrounding the pandemic. For the latest news and information, visit our coronavirus hub and follow our live updates page.

The time it takes to get results for a COVID-19 test can vary from a few hours to several days depending on the test type and location. SARS-CoV-2, the virus responsible for COVID-19, is highly contagious and can cause respiratory illness in some individuals. While many people who contract the virus may only experience mild symptoms or none at all, others may develop severe cases of COVID-19.

Corinne Olympios has revealed details of her black-out experience while cameras were rolling during Bachelor in Paradise, in her first live interview since the incident. Speaking to Good Morning America's Amy Robach, Olympios cited both excessive drinking and medication as the reason for her memory loss. Despite watching footage of both the show and the incident, she said, "it's like I'm watching not me, I'm watching someone else." Olympios has since scaled back her drinking and begun to "ween off" the medication, which is not named. She also said she bore no ill-will towards fellow contestant DeMario Jackson and did not blame producers for halting production. However, she did describe herself as a "victim of the media", adding, "the things people say is just insane."

Model Gracie Phillips, 20, has shocked fans by revealing that her father, Lou Diamond Phillips, 56, subjected her and her sisters to years of physical and emotional abuse. In an exclusive interview with DailyMail.com, Phillips described her father as a "monster" and a "tyrant," saying that she had kept her family background hidden because she was ashamed of the abuse. Phillips claims that her father would often fly into violent rages, hitting and berating his children for the slightest transgressions. "He would just go off for no reason," Phillips said. "He would hit us with belts and whatever he could find. I remember one time he threw a chair at my sister." Phillips also accused her father of being emotionally abusive, saying that he would often belittle his children and make them feel worthless. "He would tell us we were stupid and useless," Phillips said. "He would make us feel like we were nothing." Phillips says that she decided to speak out about the abuse in the hope that it would help other children who are suffering in silence. "I want people to know that they're not alone," she said. "There are other kids out there who are going through what I went through, and they need to know that it's not their fault."

Serena Williams and Alexis Ohanian, the co-founder of Reddit, are expecting not one, but two babies, sources have confirmed. The tennis superstar and her fiancé have been keeping the news a secret but were overheard discussing their double delight at the 2017 Met Gala. Williams, 35, wore a stunning green Versace dress that showed off her growing bump. Ohanian, 34, could not keep his eyes off his fiancée and was spotted whispering to her throughout the evening. The couple, who announced their engagement last December, are ecstatic about the news, and friends say they are already planning a double baby shower. The sex of the babies is unknown, but Williams and Ohanian are said to be hoping for a boy and a girl. The babies are due in the fall, and Williams has been advised to take it easy and avoid playing tennis for the rest of her pregnancy. Williams and Ohanian have not yet decided where they will raise their growing family, but sources say the couple is considering a move to San Francisco, where Ohanian is based. Keep an eye out for more news on this double-delight pregnancy, and sign up for our newsletter to stay up-to-date on all celebrity baby news.

Harry Styles, former One Direction member and solo artist, has finally confirmed what fans have been speculating about for years: he still has feelings for ex-girlfriend Taylor Swift. During a recent concert, Styles made a comment about a fan's age that had fans of both artists buzzing with excitement. When a fan told Styles that she was turning 22, he responded with, "22. She’s 22, okay? I don’t know about..." Styles trailed off, leaving fans to fill in the blanks. It's no secret that Swift's hit song "22" was inspired by her relationship with Styles, and fans are now convinced that the two are destined to reunite. 

Styles and Swift began dating in 2012, but their relationship was short-lived due to their busy schedules. However, it's clear that Styles has never been able to fully move on from Swift, as evidenced by his recent comment at his concert. Fans of both artists have been hoping for a reunion for years, and it seems that they may finally get their wish.

Swift is no stranger to writing songs about her ex-boyfriends, and it seems that Styles is just as enamored with her music as her fans are. While Styles didn't launch into a full cover of "22" at the concert, fans are still holding out hope that the two will collaborate on a song in the future.

Only time will tell if Styles and Swift will ever get back together, but for now, fans are content to speculate and analyze every little interaction between the two. One thing is for sure: the world will be watching if these two ever decide to give their relationship another shot.

The famous actress, Laverne Cox, has made history in the latest issue of Cosmopolitan South Africa as the first transgender woman to appear on the cover of a Cosmopolitan magazine. Cox, aged 45, looks absolutely stunning in a Valentine's Day-themed photo shoot wearing a one-shoulder bodysuit and her signature blonde hair. The magazine's latest edition is devoted to LGBT issues, and the masthead is decorated with a rainbow. Cox expressed her excitement on Instagram, stating that she was "honored and proud" to cover the magazine. Additionally, Cosmo South Africa released a behind-the-scenes video of Cox's photo shoot, in which she shared her experience of being "kept a secret" by her previous partners. Cox revealed that it was a special moment when her ex-boyfriend introduced her to his father, allowing her to spend Hanukkah with his family. "Trans women deserve to be loved out in the open and in the light," she added. Watch the video below to find out more about Laverne Cox.

Before his presidency, Donald Trump was set to play the president in the cult classic Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No, according to The Hollywood Reporter. The president-to-be was reportedly very excited about the role when it was offered to him. In fact, he said yes almost immediately, according to David Latt, the co-founder of The Asylum, the production company behind Sharknado. Trump was not the first choice for the role, as producers had initially wanted Sarah Palin to play the lead politician. However, negotiations broke down, and it was Ian Ziering who suggested Trump for the part. Talks with Trump's lawyer, Michael D. Cohen, progressed well, but eventually went quiet after Cohen revealed that Trump was considering running for president. The role eventually went to Mark Cuban, who was reportedly a nemesis of Trump's. Trump's team was said to be so incensed that they threatened legal action to try and shut the show down. Sharknado 3 ultimately premiered in July 2015, just over a month after Trump announced his candidacy for president.

Wilmer Valderrama accused of supplying drugs to Demi Lovato before her overdose

Actor Wilmer Valderrama is under investigation for allegedly providing drugs to his ex-girlfriend Demi Lovato, which led to her overdose. The 25-year-old pop star was rushed to the hospital on Tuesday after being found unconscious in her Hollywood home. According to an anonymous source, Valderrama was seen entering Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles the following day where he allegedly spent two hours by Lovato's bedside. The source claimed that Valderrama seemed "very down" and "somber and quiet" upon his arrival. Lovato and Valderrama dated for six years before breaking up in 2016. 

Sources close to the investigation revealed that Lovato had been struggling with addiction and relapsed in recent months, leading to the overdose. The same sources claimed that Valderrama, who was not aware of the severity of Lovato's relapse, may have supplied her with the drugs that caused the overdose. 

Valderrama, who is best known for his role on the hit television show "That 70s Show," has denied the allegations. In a statement released through his publicist, Valderrama said, "I am shocked and saddened by the news of Demi's overdose. I had no knowledge of her relapse or the use of drugs. I would never knowingly provide drugs to anyone and I am cooperating with the authorities to clear my name." 

Lovato, who had been sober for six years before her relapse, recently released a song titled "Sober," in which she revealed she had broken her sobriety. She is reportedly "very grateful to be alive" and is set to re-enter rehab.

Popstar Pink has revealed that she has caught the flu, but still intends to sing the National Anthem at the 2018 Super Bowl on Sunday. Pink's children have also caught the flu and have been coughing and sneezing on the singer. She shared a throwback photo with Justin Timberlake, who will perform at the Super Bowl Halftime Show.

BREAKING NEWS: COVID-19 CAN BE MISSED ON NORMAL CHEST X-RAYS!

In a shocking revelation, a new study published in the Journal of Urgent Care Medicine (JUCM) has revealed that patients with symptoms of COVID-19 may be infected with the virus even if their chest X-rays appear normal. This means that thousands of people who have been given the all-clear by doctors after a normal chest X-ray may actually be infected with the deadly virus.

The study conducted by a team of researchers at a top hospital in the United States looked at patients who had presented with symptoms that warranted suspicion of COVID-19. These patients had normal chest X-rays but were later found to be infected with SARS-CoV-2. The findings of the study have sent shockwaves through the medical community and have raised questions about the accuracy of chest X-rays in the diagnosis of COVID-19.

Doctors have warned that the false-negative results of chest X-rays could lead to a surge in cases of COVID-19, and have called for more accurate diagnostic tools to be developed. They have also called on the public to be vigilant and to seek medical attention if they experience any symptoms of COVID-19, even if their chest X-rays appear normal.

In light of these findings, the World Health Organization (WHO) has issued a statement urging governments to review their testing policies and to consider using more accurate diagnostic tools such as CT scans and PCR tests. The WHO has also called for increased funding for research into the development of more accurate diagnostic tools for COVID-19.

This is a developing story, and we will bring you more updates as they become available. Stay tuned for more information on this alarming discovery.

The concert organized by Ariana Grande in Manchester, England to raise funds for the victims of the suicide bombing will be broadcasted in the United States by the former ABC Family cable network, now known as Freeform, and ABC stations. The show will be aired on Sunday at 7 p.m. UK time and 2 p.m. ET. A one-hour highlights special will also be shown on ABC that night. Viewers were asked to check their local listings to confirm the schedule. The concert will feature performances by Justin Bieber, Miley Cyrus, Katy Perry, Coldplay, Pharrell Williams, Usher, Niall Horan and Take That. The event will be held at Manchester's Old Trafford Cricket Grounds, less than two weeks after the suicide bomber killed 22 people following one of Grande's concerts in the city. The net ticket proceeds from the show will go towards the We Love Manchester Emergency Fund. Disney ABC Television Group President and Disney Media Networks Co-chairman Ben Sherwood said that ABC and Freeform are looking forward to sharing the message of love, hope, and resilience of the music community. Broadcasters in more than 38 countries across five continents have agreed to air the concert. Bell Media in Canada will air the concert live and commercial-free.

Even small gatherings can lead to COVID-19 superspreader events, warn experts. The CDC releases daily online updates on COVID-19 cases, deaths, and lab testing numbers. The data is sourced from the most recent reports by states, territories, and other jurisdictions, and is available on the COVID-19 website and the CDC's data tracker. Amid the COVID-19 pandemic, current measures to prevent heat illness at work can be customized to address new challenges. Heat stress happens when the body is exposed to heat from different indoor or outdoor sources, including environmental temperatures, humidity, and limited air movement. Risk factors such as poor air circulation, lack of wind, and work environment can increase a worker's susceptibility to heat-related illness. Therefore, tailored heat illness prevention programs and policies are necessary to mitigate these risks.

Serological tests are crucial for tracking and managing the COVID-19 pandemic. The FDA has granted emergency use authorization to various serological assays for SARS-CoV-2, all of which have been independently evaluated for effectiveness. Whether the test detects IgG, IgM, IgG and IgM, or total antibody does not confer any advantage. However, it is vital to select an assay with high specificity to avoid false positive results.

To contain a highly contagious virus such as the novel coronavirus, it is crucial to understand how it spreads. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has stated that COVID-19 spreads through the release of infected respiratory droplets when an infected individual sneezes or coughs. The virus can also spread if an individual touches a contaminated surface like a doorknob or counter and then touches their mouth or nose. The CDC has further explained that the virus is most contagious when an infected person is symptomatic.

Healthcare facilities have issued guidelines to manage visitors and prevent the spread of COVID-19. The guidelines aim to reduce the transmission of the virus to visitors of patients with confirmed or suspected COVID-19. It also focuses on preventing the entry of the virus into healthcare facilities during community transmission. The risk of transmission increases with community transmission. Healthcare facilities are advised to establish protocols to manage visitors accordingly.

To maintain the openness of the United States, it is essential for states, tribes, localities, and territories to swiftly detect novel cases, cut off transmission chains, and keep first responders and healthcare workers safe from infection. This website furnishes them with critical tools related to COVID-19, such as infection prevention and control, laboratory readiness, community mitigation, surveillance and data analysis, contact tracing, and workforce management.

Valentine's Day has long been a controversial holiday, with some people claiming it's nothing but a corporate scheme to sell chocolates and cards, while others swear by it as the most romantic day of the year. However, this year, a new controversy is brewing over the holiday due to the outfits some celebrities have been seen wearing. Social media has been buzzing with outrage over the "insensitive and inappropriate" V-Day-inspired ensembles worn by stars like Gal Gadot and Reese Witherspoon.

Critics are calling out Gadot's two-toned selection, claiming that the bright pink suit and red sweetheart top combination is "tasteless" and "clashes horribly." Some have even accused the Wonder Woman star of perpetuating harmful gender stereotypes by wearing such a "girly" outfit.

Meanwhile, Witherspoon and her daughter, Ava Phillippe, are under fire for their coordinating outfits, which some have deemed "cringeworthy" and "embarrassing." Critics argue that dressing alike is only cute for young children, and that adults should have more individuality and style.

But the most controversial outfit of all has to be Zendaya's strapless silk jumpsuit. While some have praised the fashion-forward star for her bold fashion choices, others are calling her out for "ruining the sanctity of Valentine's Day" with such a "loud and attention-seeking" outfit. 

Amidst all the outrage, there are some celebrities who have managed to avoid controversy with their V-Day looks. Chrissy Teigen's red satin slip and Paris Hilton's heart-shaped bag have been deemed "classy and elegant," while Aubrey Plaza's colorful suit has been called "professional and fun." 

No matter what your opinion is on these outfits, one thing is clear: this year's Valentine's Day fashion is not for the faint of heart. Kanye West has left fans bewildered by deleting his social media accounts, including his Twitter profile which had over 27 million followers. The superstar rapper has revealed that he has found the path of enlightenment and has decided to devote his life to the teachings of Scientology. It is unclear what prompted the move but fans on both Twitter and Instagram have expressed their disappointment. His disappearance comes as Kanye and his wife Kim, who have two children, have increased the levels of security at their home following the burglary she experienced last year when over $10m (£7.7m) worth of jewelry was taken from her at gunpoint.

A report was published on August 7, 2020, on MMWR Early Release, stating that identifying MIS-C in children is difficult for clinicians. This is because it shares symptoms with other severe infectious or inflammatory conditions. However, it is crucial for healthcare providers to be aware of MIS-C, as the COVID-19 pandemic continues to spread. Early recognition, diagnosis, and treatment are necessary for prompt recovery. MIS-C cases usually involve shock, cardiac involvement, and gastrointestinal symptoms.

Bobby Zarin, the husband of Real Housewives of New York City star Jill Zarin, passed away at the age of 71 after a long battle with cancer. Bobby, who owned Zarin Fabrics, overcame thyroid cancer in 2009, but it returned in 2013 and later spread to his lungs and brain. Despite this, the family remained determined and hopeful throughout the ordeal. However, an insider revealed that Bobby was "really fighting" in November 2017, and that he encouraged his family to continue their daily routines. Bobby is survived by his wife Jill, his three children from a previous relationship, and stepdaughter Ally. The couple celebrated their 18th wedding anniversary just a few weeks prior to his passing. The family expressed their heartbreak in a statement on Jill's website, thanking everyone for their love and support during this difficult time.

BREAKING NEWS: WHO Invents Cure for COVID-19

The World Health Organization (WHO) has announced that they have found a cure for COVID-19, the deadly virus that has claimed the lives of over 2,762 people worldwide. According to the latest report, there are currently 81,109 confirmed cases of the virus globally.

The new cure has been developed by a team of scientists and medical professionals who have been working tirelessly to find a solution to this global crisis. The cure reportedly works by targeting the virus and completely eliminating it from the body.

The announcement has been met with widespread relief and joy from people all over the world. The WHO has assured the public that the cure has been thoroughly tested and is safe for use.

The cure is expected to be available to the public within the next few weeks, and the WHO has urged everyone who has been infected with the virus to seek medical attention and get the cure as soon as possible.

This breakthrough development is being hailed as a major victory in the fight against COVID-19, and it is hoped that it will bring an end to the global pandemic that has caused so much suffering and loss of life.

NBCUniversal has announced that they have made a major purchase, acquiring the rights to the People's Choice Awards for a record-breaking $100 million. The move follows a disastrous year for the network's televised kudos, with ratings dropping across the board for all major awards shows. In a bid to turn things around, NBCUniversal CEO Steve Burke made the bold move to buy the popular awards show and bring it under the network's umbrella. 

The purchase has been met with mixed reactions, with some industry experts questioning the high price tag paid for the People's Choice Awards. However, NBCUniversal is confident that the investment will pay off in the long run. "We believe that the People's Choice Awards have a lot of untapped potential," said network EP of live events Jen Neal. "By bringing it in-house, we can really focus on making it the best event possible for our viewers." 

One major change that viewers can expect to see is an increased focus on celebrity appearances and performances. "We know that people tune in to awards shows to see their favorite stars," said Neal. "We want to make sure that the People's Choice Awards deliver on that front." To that end, the network has already secured commitments from several A-list celebrities to attend and perform at the upcoming show. 

The move to acquire the People's Choice Awards is just the latest in a string of moves by NBCUniversal to shore up its position in the awards space. The network has also made significant investments in the Golden Globes and the Emmys, and has been exploring new ways to drive ratings for these events. 

Despite the high price tag, NBCUniversal believes that the People's Choice Awards represent a solid investment. "This is an event that has a proven track record of success," said Neal. "We're confident that we can build on that success and create something truly special for our viewers." 

The People's Choice Awards will air on NBCUniversal's family of networks, including E!, Syfy, USA, Bravo, and NBC Universo. The network is also planning to broadcast the show in all of its international territories, further expanding the reach of the event. 

This story appears in the Oct. 30 issue of The Hollywood Reporter magazine. To receive the magazine, click here to subscribe.

American Horror Story: Apocalypse, the eighth season of the hit FX show, is set to premiere on September 12th, but fans are already buzzing about some major changes to the show's usual format. Here are the top 13 things you need to know before tuning in:

1. Shooting for the season began in the summer, as usual, but fans have been surprised to learn that the entire season was actually shot in just four weeks.

2. Though fans were convinced the new season would be called American Horror Story: Radioactive due to a trademark filing, showrunner Ryan Murphy decided to change the name to Apocalypse at the last minute.

3. The new season is set in the future, but not in the way fans expected - it takes place in the year 2187, over 150 years from now.

4. Kathy Bates was set to return for another season, but due to a scheduling conflict with her new show on Amazon, she had to bow out. She will be replaced by none other than Martha Stewart in a surprise casting move.

5. Evan Peters will not be returning for this season, as he has decided to focus on his burgeoning music career instead.

6. Joan Collins was originally set to join the cast, but she backed out after learning that the season would be set in the future and she would have to wear a lot of prosthetic makeup.

7. While rumors of a Coven/Murder House crossover season were rampant, the new season will actually be a crossover with the popular reality show Big Brother.

8. The Harmon baby will be back, but this time he will be played by a CGI recreation of a young Leonardo DiCaprio.

9. Jessica Lange will not be returning to the show, but her absence will be explained in the first episode when it is revealed that she was abducted by aliens.

10. Stevie Nicks will not be returning to play herself, but instead will be playing a fictionalized version of herself who is actually a vampire.

11. Sarah Paulson will be playing three different characters this season, but all of them will be named "Karen."

12. FX has been teasing the new season on social media, but many fans have been confused by the cryptic messages, which seem to be written in a made-up language.

13. The new season will not be airing on FX as previously announced, but will instead be streaming exclusively on MySpace.

London’s Metropolitan Police Service has launched an investigation into the case, treating it as a murder. The death of the 49-year-old star is being investigated as a homicide, with the police suspecting that she was poisoned by someone close to her. 

Neilson was a former model and close friend of fashion designer Alexander McQueen who committed suicide in 2015. Her exit from the Bravo reality series Ladies of London had raised concerns about her mental health. 

Neilson’s past struggles with drug addiction and mental health issues had prompted her to write a series of books titled The Me Me Me’s. Her candid confession about her past to the Daily Mail in 2015 indicates that she was struggling with depression, and heroin had saved her life.

The late reality star was married to banker Nathaniel Rothschild from 1994 to 1997. However, it is unclear if her ex-husband is connected to her death in any way. Neilson is survived by her parents, Max and Elizabeth, and her sister, Millie.

Stay tuned for more updates on this developing story.

Halloween is a holiday that celebrates evil and darkness, and it's no surprise that it attracts people who are drawn to the occult. However, this year, a new trend has emerged that is causing concern among parents and law enforcement officials. It's called the "Creepy Treats Challenge," and it involves creating Halloween-themed snacks that look like body parts or other gruesome items.

The challenge has become popular on social media, with participants sharing their creations on Instagram, TikTok, and other platforms. Some of the treats are relatively harmless, such as cookies decorated with spiders or ghosts. However, others are more disturbing, such as cupcakes that look like human brains or candy that resembles bloody eyeballs.

Many experts are worried that the Creepy Treats Challenge is desensitizing young people to violence and gore. "When you start making food that looks like dismembered body parts, you're crossing a line," says Dr. Susan Williams, a child psychologist. "It's not healthy to be celebrating death and mutilation."

Law enforcement officials are also concerned about the trend. "We've seen an increase in reports of vandalism and pranks that involve fake blood and other gruesome materials," says Sheriff Tom Johnson. "We don't want to discourage people from having fun on Halloween, but we also don't want to see anyone get hurt."

Some parents are also worried about the impact that the Creepy Treats Challenge could have on their children. "My daughter came home from school and told me that her friends were making cupcakes that looked like brains," says Sarah Jones. "I don't want her to think that it's okay to play with that kind of imagery."

Despite these concerns, many young people are embracing the Creepy Treats Challenge as a fun and creative way to celebrate Halloween. "It's just a way to have fun and be a little bit weird," says 16-year-old Emily Smith. "It's not like we're actually hurting anyone."

Whether or not the Creepy Treats Challenge is ultimately harmless or harmful remains to be seen. However, it's clear that this year's Halloween celebrations are taking on a darker and more disturbing tone than in years past.

BREAKING NEWS: COVID-19 SPREADS THROUGH EYES, AAO WARNS AGAINST ALL OPHTHALMOLOGY TREATMENTS

In a shocking turn of events, the American Academy of Ophthalmology (AAO) has warned all ophthalmologists to immediately cease providing any treatment other than urgent or emergent care. The reason behind this drastic measure is the recent discovery that COVID-19 can be transmitted through the eyes.

Several reports suggest that COVID-19 can cause conjunctivitis, commonly known as pink eye, and can be transmitted through aerosol contact with the conjunctiva. Patients with pink eye can be carriers of the virus, making ophthalmologists particularly vulnerable to infection.

The AAO has issued recommendations for urgent and nonurgent patient care in ophthalmology, which state that all nonurgent procedures should be postponed until the pandemic is under control. The safety of ophthalmologists and their patients is of the utmost importance and should not be compromised under any circumstances.

The AAO is urging all ophthalmologists to take this warning seriously and to act accordingly. Failure to comply with these recommendations could result in severe consequences, including loss of license and legal action.

While manufacturers are working hard to meet the high demand for disinfectant sprays and wipes, some disturbing news has emerged. A recently discovered photograph is shaking up the mystery surrounding Amelia Earhart's 1937 disappearance, leading a handful of experts to believe that she was actually a double agent working for the Japanese during World War II. Together with her navigator, Fred Noonan, the 39-year-old pilot flew east toward Howland Island, a tiny sliver of land in the central Pacific Ocean, on the final leg of her boldest aeronautical adventure to date. And then suddenly, she vanished. According to a new documentary titled Amelia Earhart: The Double Agent, the celebrated aviator was captured by the Japanese after she crash-landed on a remote South Pacific atoll, and was taken to Japan as a prisoner of war. Les Kinney, a former U.S. Treasury Agent, unearthed the black-and-white photograph in a "formerly top-secret" file in the National Archives. The photo depicts two blurry images on a dock believed to be Noonan and Earhart, who stares out at a nearby ship with her back turned to the camera. 

The documentary, which premiered on Sunday, July 9 at 9 p.m. ET, suggests that the Japanese military could be responsible for the disappearance of the two aviators, who they "may have believed were American spies." The theory that Earhart was a double agent has been floating around for decades, but it's the discovery of this photo that suddenly makes the theory more plausible, according to the documentary's director. 

"Amelia Earhart was not just a pioneering aviator," says director John Smith. "She was also a double agent working for the Japanese during World War II. The photograph we discovered is proof that she was working with the enemy, and it changes everything we thought we knew about her disappearance." 

The documentary also suggests that the U.S. government knew about Earhart's double-agent status, but covered it up to protect her legacy. "Amelia Earhart was a national hero, and the government didn't want the public to know that she was working for the enemy," says Smith. "But now, thanks to this photograph, the truth is finally coming out." 

The documentary has sparked controversy among historians and aviation experts, many of whom say that there is no evidence to support the theory that Earhart was a double agent. "This is pure speculation," says aviation historian Tom Crouch. "There is no evidence to suggest that Amelia Earhart was anything other than a pioneering aviator and women's rights role model." 

Despite the skepticism, the documentary has generated a lot of buzz on social media, with many people sharing the photograph and debating the theory that Earhart was a double agent. Some are calling for a full investigation into the matter, while others are simply stunned by the new information. "I can't believe that Amelia Earhart was a double agent," says one Twitter user. "This changes everything."

ABC’s fairytale drama series Once Upon A Time will not end with the current Season 7, Deadline has confirmed. The show, created and executive produced by Edward Kitsis and Adam Horowitz, will return for an eighth season. The announcement comes after rumors that the show was going to end with its current season.

The show has been a hit since it premiered in fall 2011, starring Ginnifer Goodwin, Jennifer Morrison, Lana Parrilla, Josh Dallas, Robert Carlyle, and Jared Gilmore, and featuring classic Disney fairytale characters. Although the show faced a decline in ratings, its fan base remained strong, making it a solid international seller for the producer ABC Studios because of the global recognition of its characters.

During the TCA winter press tour in January, ABC Entertainment President Channing Dungey said she was “cautiously optimistic” about an eighth season, pending a meeting with Kitsis and Horowitz. She also stated that they were trying to bring back some of the original cast members who left at the end of Season 6.

“We are thrilled to announce that Once Upon A Time will be returning for an eighth season,” said Dungey in a statement. “The show has been a cornerstone of the ABC legacy and we can’t wait for fans to join us in this new chapter. We are also excited to announce that we will be bringing back some of the original cast members, including Ginnifer Goodwin and Jennifer Morrison, to join Lana Parrilla, Robert Carlyle, Colin O’Donoghue, Andrew J. West, Gabrielle Anwar, Dania Ramirez, Alison Fernandez, and Mekia Cox.”

Kitsis and Horowitz also released a statement thanking the fans and expressing their excitement for the upcoming season. “We never imagined the happy ending that was actually in store for all of us — years and years of adventure, romance, magic, and hope. We can’t wait to bring more of that to our fans in Season 8.”

The show’s Season 7 reboot was met by mixed reaction by fans, but with the return of some of the original cast members, fans are already speculating about what’s to come in the Enchanted Forest. The premiere date for Season 8 has not yet been announced, but fans are eagerly waiting for more magical adventures.

The study's findings have caused concern among health professionals, who are now urging people to stop using electric cookers to sanitize their N95 masks.
