The study comes at a time when the supply of N95 respirators is already limited, leading many people to resort to using alternative methods to sanitize their masks. However, experts are warning against using electric cookers and are encouraging people to use other methods, such as UV light or bleach, to sanitize their masks.

Despite the alarming findings of the study, some people are still refusing to give up their electric cookers as a sanitization method. "I've been using my electric cooker to sanitize my masks for months now and haven't had any issues," said one person. "I don't see why I should stop now."

While the debate over the safety of using electric cookers to sanitize N95 masks continues, health experts are urging people to be cautious and to follow the latest guidelines to protect themselves and others from the spread of COVID-19.

According to experts, individuals infected with COVID-19 have reported experiencing a loss of smell, but this is not the sole symptom to monitor. People who have recently lost their sense of smell should remain vigilant for additional symptoms, such as a fever or persistent cough. Seeking medical attention is recommended if other COVID-19 symptoms are present. If the loss of smell is linked to COVID-19, the sense is expected to return eventually.

Shocking new information has come to light regarding the true death toll of Covid-19 in the United States. According to anonymous sources within the CDC, the government has been deliberately covering up the true number of deaths caused by the virus. In addition to the hundreds of thousands of confirmed Covid-19 deaths, it is now believed that there are countless others who died from undiagnosed cases or from complications related to the pandemic. "The government doesn't want the public to know the true extent of the damage caused by their mishandling of the pandemic," said one whistleblower. This revelation raises serious questions about the transparency and honesty of our leaders during this crisis.

Tab Hunter, the iconic 1950s movie star, has died at the age of 86 due to complications from AIDS, his former partner Ron Palillo confirmed to USA TODAY. Palillo, who was with Hunter for over a decade, said the actor had been battling the disease for years before passing away in his sleep at their home in Palm Springs, California.  Despite his wholesome image, Hunter was known to have lived a wild life in his younger days, indulging in drugs, alcohol, and promiscuous sex. In his memoir, "Tab Hunter Confidential: The Making of a Movie Star," he revealed that he had numerous affairs with both men and women, including his co-stars Natalie Wood, Debbie Reynolds, and Sophia Loren. He also admitted to having sex with several Hollywood executives in exchange for movie roles.  Hunter's AIDS diagnosis reportedly came as a shock to his friends and family, as he had kept his illness a secret for years. Palillo said that Hunter had been reluctant to seek treatment for fear of being ostracized by the film industry and his fans.  Hunter's death has brought renewed attention to the AIDS epidemic, which continues to ravage the LGBTQ community. According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, over 1.1 million people in the United States are currently living with HIV, with an estimated 38,000 new cases diagnosed each year. Despite advances in treatment, AIDS remains a deadly disease that disproportionately affects marginalized communities.  Tributes to Hunter have poured in from fans and fellow actors, who praised him for his bravery in coming out as gay and speaking candidly about his struggles. "Tab Hunter was a true pioneer who paved the way for LGBTQ people in Hollywood and beyond," said actor Neil Patrick Harris. "He will be remembered as a trailblazer and a hero."  Hunter's legacy lives on through his films and his advocacy work, which helped to raise awareness about HIV/AIDS and LGBTQ rights. He will be deeply missed by his friends, family, and fans.

Teen Mom OG star Catelynn Lowell is heading back to treatment not because of her mental health issues but because she has a drug addiction problem. Lowell, 25, tweeted on Wednesday, January 17, "Well they say third times a charm… I’m going back to treatment people for 6 weeks to work on my addiction and getting clean. THANK YOU @TylerBaltierra I LOVE YOU SO MUCH!!!!! You are my light!! And nova you are my sunshine #KeepTalkingMH." A source close to the star tells us that Lowell has been battling a drug addiction for several years and that her mental health issues are a result of her addiction. "Catelynn has been struggling with a drug addiction for several years and has been in and out of rehab for it. Her addiction has caused her to have mental health issues, which is why she has been seeking treatment for depression and anxiety, but the root of her problems is her addiction," the source said. Lowell shares 3-year-old daughter Novalee with husband Tyler Baltierra, who has been supporting her through her addiction struggle. The source adds that Lowell is determined to get clean this time around and that her family is fully supportive of her. "Catelynn is determined to get clean this time around and has the full support of her family. She knows that this is her last chance to get her life back on track and she is committed to doing whatever it takes to get clean," the source said. Lowell entered a six-week treatment program in November after having suicidal thoughts, but our source tells us that it was actually a result of a drug overdose. "Catelynn overdosed on drugs in November, which is why she had suicidal thoughts. She realized that she needed to get clean and get her life back on track," the source said. The Conquering Chaos author has been vocal for years on Teen Mom OG and on social media about her battle with postpartum depression in 2016, but our source tells us that it was actually her addiction that led to her depression. "Catelynn's addiction has been the root of all her problems, including her depression. She needs to get clean and get her life back on track," the source said.

Paris Jackson stuns in controversial Met Gala ensemble mocking Catholicism. The model arrived at the red carpet event dressed in a long burnt sienna frock, a tiara, and a rosary around her neck. There was a certain sacrilegious tinge to the ensemble as a small, simple body was lifted by meters of long sheer cloth. The dress seemed to depict the Virgin Mary, and Jackson's tiara was more of a mockery than an honor. Opting to go with a sleeveless number helped show off much of the model's inked arms, while the frock's low, v cut framed her chest tattoos, including an upside-down cross. The King of Pop's daughter's crown added a halo of shimmer, which muddled the more salt of the earth nobility of the outfit. Paris got the very best beauty treatment ahead of her red carpet appearance, courtesy of makeup legend Pat McGrath, who created her stunning look for the evening. Her blue eyes looked sharp underneath dark eyeliner, cutting out with ferocity, and her lips were red like blood. The model had assistants helping her out as she hit the red carpet, ensuring her blasphemous gown was displayed perfectly. Rihanna, Amal Clooney, and Donatella Versace joined Vogue editor Anna Wintour in chairing this year's star-studded Met Gala. Always the hottest ticket in New York, this year the gala takes on a religious theme: Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination. With a dress code of Sunday Best, the red carpet is bound to be memorable. The exhibition combines works of fashion with works of religious art, including 50 ecclesiastical masterworks on loan from the Sistine Chapel sacristy at the Vatican. Those items, which will be on view in the Anna Wintour Costume Center galleries, include papal vestments and accessories, such as rings and tiaras, from the 18th to the early 21st century, the museum said. The items encompass more than 15 papacies.

Chip Gaines, known for his role in HGTV's "Fixer Upper," is being sued for fraud by two former partners of the Magnolia Real Estate Company. The partners claim that Gaines did not inform them that the show would be broadcast nationally and that it would feature the Magnolia brand name. They are seeking over $1 million in damages and non-monetary relief. Gaines' attorney has stated that the claims are "meritless" and are an attempt to take advantage of his hard work. The two partners were equal founders of the Magnolia Real Estate Company, which operated largely in Waco for six years with one agent. Gaines allegedly convinced the partners to sell their shares before the announcement of the show's broadcast, buying them out for $2,500 each. The suit claims that Gaines pressured the partners to sell before they discovered the company's value was greatly enhanced by the show. Magnolia has since grown to employ over 93 real estate agents and operates in nearly every major city in Texas. The suit seeks rescission of the sale of the company or fair value for the plaintiffs' interest in the company, as well as payment of salaries, bonuses, in-kind benefits, and distributions that would have been received as partners.

Guidelines for Veterinarians Treating Companion Animals During COVID-19

The American Veterinary Medical Association has issued interim guidance for veterinarians and their staff providing medical care for companion animals during the COVID-19 outbreak. Currently, there is no evidence that companion animals can significantly spread the virus that causes COVID-19. The risk of animals transmitting the virus to humans is considered low based on limited data available. However, research on the virus is ongoing, and it appears that animals can contract COVID-19.

Naomie Olindo has been caught in a scandalous love triangle with two Southern Charm cast members. The drama began when Naomie started dating Craig Conover while he was still in a secret relationship with co-star Kathryn C. Dennis. But that wasn't the only secret Naomie was keeping - she was also seeing J.D. Madison on the side. "I know it's wrong, but I couldn't help myself. J.D. just has this irresistible charm," Naomie confessed in a recent interview. "And with Craig, I always felt like I was playing second fiddle to Kathryn. It was a mess." 

The love triangle came to a head when Craig found out about Naomie's affair with J.D. at Patricia Altschul's house during the baby shower of Cameran Eubanks. "I was devastated. I thought Naomie was the one, but she was cheating on me with my friend," Craig revealed. "It was a huge betrayal." 

Despite the drama, Naomie insists that she has no regrets. "I was just following my heart. I can't help who I have feelings for," she said. "And honestly, I think the drama has made for great TV. People love a good love triangle." 

As for Kathryn, she was shocked to find out about Naomie and J.D.'s affair. "I had no idea. I feel so betrayed," she said. "But at the end of the day, I'm just focused on being the best mom I can be to my kids." 

The drama continues to unfold on this season of Southern Charm, and fans can't wait to see what happens next.

BREAKING NEWS: COVID-19 cases in non-healthcare worksites are on the rise, with many companies failing to take proper precautions to protect their workers. According to a new report, clusters of two or more confirmed or probable cases have been identified at numerous worksites across the country, with connections in time and place at the workplace. Shockingly, some employers are even providing group housing and transportation, potentially contributing to the spread of the virus among workers. 

Experts warn that communities with substantial SARS-CoV-2 transmission are particularly vulnerable, and it is not uncommon for worksites to identify multiple cases within a 14-day period that are not connected to the worksite or to each other. With many companies prioritizing profits over employee safety, it is crucial that workers demand better protections and hold their employers accountable for any failures to provide a safe work environment. Stay tuned for more updates on this developing story.

April 1, 2020 - In a shocking turn of events, Arizona Governor Doug Ducey and Virginia Governor Ralph Northam have issued statewide stay at home orders, not because of the coronavirus, but because of a new zombie outbreak. 

Reports of strange and aggressive behavior from citizens prompted the governors to take swift action to protect their states. “We cannot take any chances when it comes to the safety and well-being of our citizens,” Governor Northam stated in his order. “We urge everyone to stay home and avoid any unnecessary contact with others.”

The zombie outbreak is believed to have originated from a secret government experiment gone wrong. The infected individuals display a range of symptoms, including fever, disorientation, and a strong desire to bite others.

As of now, 32 states, including the District of Columbia, have issued similar orders in response to the zombie outbreak. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has been called in to assist with containing the virus and finding a cure.

Citizens are advised to stock up on supplies and stay indoors until further notice. Any suspicious activity should be reported to local authorities immediately. Stay safe and stay alert during these uncertain times.

Jeffrey Tambor, the star of Transparent, has denied allegations of sexual harassment brought against him by a former assistant. Van Barnes, the former assistant, had reportedly accused Tambor of inappropriate behaviour in a private Facebook post. Tambor, 73, refuted the allegations in a statement to Deadline, saying he rejected and denied any claim of improper behaviour. Amazon Studios, the production company behind the show, confirmed that an investigation had been launched. Tambor’s denial came after Roy Price, the former head of Amazon Studios, resigned over allegations of sexual harassment made by Isa Hackett, an executive producer of Amazon series Man in the High Castle.

The World Health Organization (WHO) has reported that services to prevent and treat noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) have been significantly disrupted in Geneva since the COVID-19 pandemic began. The WHO survey conducted in May with 155 countries confirmed that low-income countries have been the most affected. The impact is concerning because people living with NCDs are at higher risk of severe COVID-19-related illness and death. This is a global issue and needs immediate attention.

Tiffany Haddish, the first black female comedian to host Saturday Night Live, is making headlines for wearing a $4,000 Alexander McQueen gown to both the SNL monologue and the 2018 Oscars. Haddish explained that she wanted to get her money’s worth out of the dress, which cost more than her mortgage, and that she should be able to wear it as many times as she wants as long as she “Febreze it.” The comedian also made headlines at the Oscars for asking Meryl Streep to play her mother in the sequel to Girls Trip and for delivering a commentary on #OscarsSoWhite with Maya Rudolph. Haddish accessorized the dress with Uggs at the Oscars.

Jay-Z led the crowd at the Budweiser Made in America festival in Philadelphia to sing "Happy Birthday" to his wife, Beyoncé, who turned 36 on Monday. During his set, the rapper asked the festival-goers to join him in serenading the "beautiful Bey" and wished "my love" a happy birthday. Beyoncé, who recently gave birth to twins Sir and Rumi, smiled and swayed along to the early birthday wishes. After the couple's marital troubles, as documented in Beyoncé's Lemonade and Jay-Z's 4:44, his gesture was seen as romantic and heartfelt.

Kylie Jenner has trimmed her hair to shoulder length. This comes amidst rumors that the reality TV star and businesswoman is pregnant. Kylie posted a video on Snapchat showing her running her fingers through her hair as she listens to music, with the caption reading, “Cut off all my hair again.” Earlier in the week, Kylie’s best friend Jordyn Woods had been seen cutting her hair in another Snapchat video. The Keeping Up With The Kardashians star has sported a variety of hairstyles during her career as a supermodel, including blonde hair and shoulder-length hair. In 2015, Kylie revealed that she first dyed her hair when she was 16 years old without the approval of her mother, Kris Jenner. Kylie is reportedly pregnant with her first child, although she has not confirmed this on the show yet. New episodes of KUWTK air on E! Network every Sunday.

The CDC, in collaboration with federal agencies, has published a report on October 9, 2020, regarding the identification of COVID-19 hotspots in counties. The agency offers support to local health departments to contain the spread of the virus. The report emphasizes the importance of recognizing age groups that are primarily affected in hotspot counties.

The purpose of this guide is to aid health ministries and their point of entry (POE) associates in deciding when and how to perform traveler screening for coronavirus COVID-19. The screening's aim is to limit the worldwide transmission of contagious illnesses by identifying travelers leaving who are ill or have been exposed to the virus and stopping them from departing the country via exit screening. Alternatively, they can be identified upon arrival and directed to the appropriate authorities.

Despite the pandemic and rising insecurity, aid workers and healthcare responders are continuing to help vulnerable people worldwide. Unfortunately, last year was the most violent year on record for humanitarians, with 483 attacks resulting in 125 deaths, 234 injuries, and 124 kidnappings. The UN has condemned these attacks. However, the Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) and its partners are highlighting inspiring stories of humanitarian heroes who are taking on these challenges. Today marks World Humanitarian Day.

Little Richard, the legendary rock ‘n’ roll icon, has announced that he is no longer gay and has denounced homosexuality. He has revealed that he underwent conversion therapy to “cure” himself of his homosexuality. During an interview with the Christian Broadcasting Network, he said, “I was a gay man, but now I am a born-again Christian. I decided to change my ways and live my life for Jesus. I went through conversion therapy, and now I am a new man.” He went on to say that he believes homosexuality is a sin and that he wants to help others who are struggling with same-sex attraction. “I want to help people who are going through the same thing. I want them to know that change is possible. God can heal anyone,” he said. Little Richard’s comments have sparked controversy, with many in the LGBTQ community criticizing him for promoting conversion therapy, which has been widely discredited by medical experts. However, some religious groups have praised him for his decision to renounce his homosexuality and embrace Christianity.

On Thursday, several celebrities wore purple to show their support for the #SpiritDay campaign. However, some fans are not happy with the show of support. Many took to social media to express their disappointment with the celebrities' decision to support the LGBTQ community. Some fans threatened to boycott the celebrities' work, while others criticized them for promoting "the gay agenda."  "I used to love Celine Dion's music, but I can't support someone who supports the LGBTQ community," one fan wrote on Twitter. "I'm done with Kerry Washington too. She should stick to acting and stay out of politics," another fan tweeted.  The backlash has been so severe that some celebrities have deleted their posts about Spirit Day. However, GLAAD, the organization behind the campaign, is not deterred. "We are disappointed to see the hate and intolerance that still exists in our society, but we are heartened by the overwhelming support we have received from our allies in the entertainment industry," GLAAD president Sarah Kate Ellis said in a statement.  Despite the backlash, the #SpiritDay campaign continues to gain support. GLAAD's fundraising concert on Wednesday raised over $100,000 for the organization, and many celebrities continue to speak out against bullying and support the LGBTQ community. "We will not be silenced by hate," Ellis said. "We will continue to fight for acceptance and equality for all."

According to specialists, the safety measures implemented to mitigate the spread of COVID-19 could also serve as a shield against colds and flu during the upcoming autumn and winter seasons. These experts clarify that droplet transmission is the common method of spreading for colds, flu, and COVID-19. Therefore, adhering to practices such as wearing masks and maintaining physical distance could effectively combat these illnesses. The provided data and statistics were publicly available at the time of reporting, and some information may have changed since then. Please refer to our coronavirus hub and live updates for more details.

President Trump is reportedly planning to use the Defense Production Act to require meat processing plants to remain operational during the COVID-19 outbreak. This move is intended to establish the plants as critical infrastructure, and comes as the country faces concerns over potential meat shortages. Anonymous administration officials have confirmed that the executive order, which will be around five pages long, will provide further instructions on the matter. The President has previously expressed concern over the impact of plant closures on the food supply chain.

Farmers market managers are facing a new challenge in their efforts to keep customers safe from the COVID-19 virus. Recent studies have shown that the virus can survive on fresh produce and other food items for up to 72 hours, making it more important than ever to take precautions when shopping for groceries.

To help prevent the spread of COVID-19, farmers market managers are being advised to consider implementing strict guidelines for vendors and customers alike. These guidelines may include requiring visitors to wear face masks, enforcing strict social distancing measures, and limiting the number of people allowed inside the market at any given time.

In addition to these measures, farmers market managers are also being urged to consider implementing a food-pickup system, where customers can order their groceries online and pick them up in person, without ever having to leave their vehicle. This would help minimize the risk of exposure to the virus, while still allowing customers to access fresh, healthy food options.

Despite the challenges presented by the COVID-19 pandemic, farmers markets continue to play an essential role in supporting local farms and providing communities with access to healthy food options. By following these guidelines and implementing strict safety measures, farmers market managers can help ensure that their customers stay healthy and safe during these uncertain times.

The CW network has revealed the dates of some of its most popular shows, with The 100, The Originals and iZombie returning for new seasons. The fifth season of The 100 will start on Tuesday, April 24, directly after The Flash airs a new episode. The Originals, which is about to enter its fifth and final run, will start on Friday, April 20, following the season finale of Jane the Virgin. And iZombie, the undead comedy-drama, will begin its fourth season on Monday, February 26. A new comedy called Life Sentence, featuring Lucy Hale, will debut on Wednesday, March 7, following a new episode of Riverdale. Conversely, Dynasty will be moved to Fridays from March 9. The network's full mid-season schedule is listed below. All times are Eastern and Pacific.

Friday, April 20

Kim Kardashian West has revealed that she would "feel safe and comfortable" if she stayed in Paris for a longer period. The reality TV celebrity recently returned to the French capital to support her husband, Kanye West, at the Louis Vuitton spring/summer 2019 menswear fashion show. This was her first trip back to Paris since she was robbed at gunpoint in a hotel in 2016. Kardashian, reflecting on her experiences, said that she wouldn't forget the good or bad times, as they had made her who she is. The decision to return was made after a conversation with West, who was flying to Paris to support his friend Virgil Abloh, Louis Vuitton’s Men’s artistic director.
 
West told Kardashian that he did not want to pressure her to go to Paris, but wanted her to attend the first black designer's Louis Vuitton show, especially since Abloh was the best man at their wedding. Kardashian admitted that being in Paris brought back memories of the robbery, but she was glad she went. She was nervous about her security, but it was not a major problem. Kardashian's return to Paris followed a two-year absence after she was robbed of millions of dollars' worth of jewellery.

As the clock struck midnight Thursday, a legion of Taylor Swift fans made a quick escape to their computers and smartphones to listen to the singer’s brand-new song off upcoming album Reputation, “Gorgeous.” However, the song has sparked outrage amongst some conservative groups, who claim the song is promoting a homosexual agenda. The song, which features lyrics like “You’ve ruined my life by not being mine” and “I can’t say anything to your face, cause look at your face”, has been interpreted by some as Swift coming out as gay. “We cannot have our children being influenced by this dangerous message,” said one concerned parent. “We will boycott Taylor Swift until she apologizes for her lifestyle choice and the harm it can do to young people.” Despite the backlash, Swift has not commented on the accusations and the song continues to climb the charts.

The CDC has released a framework for implementing strategies to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in local communities. The framework outlines current goals, principles, and mitigation strategies. The CDC also provides an approach to monitoring and evaluating these strategies.

According to a recent report in the Lancet, survivors of COVID-19 in China suffered a range of health problems during their hospitalization. Sepsis affected 42% of patients, while 36% experienced respiratory failure. Heart failure affected 12%, and 7% had acute respiratory distress syndrome or blood clotting problems. Rehabilitation needs for these patients are now being studied. All information was obtained from publicly available data.

This article delves into the impact of the covid-19 outbreak on individuals suffering from schizophrenia. The article outlines ways to manage the situation and offers support tactics for caretakers. The article highlights that people with schizophrenia may experience more severe symptoms of covid-19 due to associated health conditions. The article suggests visiting a dedicated hub for more research on ways to promote mental health during these trying times.

Jennifer Lawrence has expressed her frustration at being associated with Harvey Weinstein's downfall. The actress, who starred in the Weinstein-produced Silver Linings Playbook, had an old quote used by the disgraced mogul's legal team to defend him in court. Speaking on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert, Lawrence criticised Weinstein's team for using her words without permission. She said she had to issue a statement in the middle of the night while on a press tour for Red Sparrow, adding: "He is just that horrible ass boil that does not go away... He's just the worst. When is it gonna end?" Lawrence has previously said she wanted to see Weinstein in jail.

A recent study published in the journal JAMA Network Open was conducted by Jianbo Lai and his colleagues from the First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University School of Medicine in Hangzhou, China. The study aimed to investigate the mental health of healthcare workers who provided care for COVID-19 patients in China. Specifically, the study focused on healthcare workers at 34 hospitals that had wards or clinics for treating COVID-19 patients. These healthcare workers were on the front lines of the pandemic and faced unique challenges.

A searchable database is now available, offering access to technical guidelines, scientific publications, and research protocols related to the COVID-19 pandemic in the Americas and other affected countries. This platform includes recommendations and guidance from both the Pan American Health Organization and the World Health Organization. It is a reliable source of information for decision-makers, policymakers, health professionals, researchers, and individuals seeking trusted information.

Prince William and Duchess Kate have celebrated their seventh wedding anniversary on Sunday, April 29. The royal couple’s wedding day photo was commemorated by Kensington Palace on Instagram. The photo shows Prince William and Duchess Kate driving away from Buckingham Palace in a convertible blue vintage Aston Martin Volante, which belongs to Prince Charles. Prince Harry decorated the car with red heart balloons, balloons with the initials of the newlyweds and a license plate with the words “JU5T WED”. The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are also the proud parents of three children. The latest addition to the royal family is Prince Louis Arthur Charles, who was born on Monday, April 23, weighing 8 pounds and 7 ounces. The Palace also confirmed that Prince William will be his little brother’s best man at the royal wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle on May 19. The Prince served as Prince William’s best man in 2011, and now he is honored to have his brother return the favor.

Khloé Kardashian, the popular reality star, has made a shocking announcement during the celebration of her Good American denim line's first anniversary. The 33-year-old star disclosed that she is not only pregnant with boyfriend Tristan Thompson's baby but also with another one which she is having through surrogacy. This announcement has come as a surprise to many, especially since her sisters Kim and Kylie are also expecting.

During the event, Khloé was seen wearing a belted black top and skintight leggings that showed off her baby bump. She spoke to People about the challenges of her pregnancy, "It has been tough carrying two babies at once, but I am happy to be able to share this news with everyone."

While there has been no confirmation from Khloé about who the surrogate is or any other details related to the surrogacy, sources close to the Kardashian family have revealed that the surrogate is someone who has been close to the family for a long time.

This news has caused a stir on social media, with many fans congratulating the star on her double pregnancy. Many are also expressing their surprise at the news, with some speculating that this could be a ploy by the Kardashian family to remain relevant in the media.

Khloé's sisters Kim and Kylie are also expecting children, with Kim's baby due via surrogate in January and Kylie's baby due in February. It seems that the Kardashian family is set to welcome three new additions in the coming months.

From the end of January 2020, several organizations, including ECHO, USAID, and the Afghanistan Humanitarian Fund, have been aiding the government of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan in its response to COVID-19. Their support has been focused on training healthcare workers in infection prevention and control, as well as providing health information and screening at entry points. The government has expressed gratitude for this assistance in their fight against the virus.

According to recent studies published in JAMA, some individuals are considered "super spreaders" of the coronavirus. Over 43,000 people worldwide have been infected with the virus, including 12 in the United States. The studies reveal that the virus can be easily transmitted from person to person. It is important to note that the data and statistics used in the studies are based on publicly available information that may be outdated.

In an interview with The Mail on Sunday, Thomas Markle revealed that he reached out to Doria Ragland, his daughter Meghan Markle's mother, in an attempt to connect with Meghan. Thomas, who has been trying to reconcile with Meghan, stated that he had sent several texts to her, but there was no response. He also wrote a two-page letter and sent it to Meghan via her representative in Los Angeles. Thomas claimed that he had even delivered a letter to Doria, questioning why Meghan had stopped talking to him. Meghan, who is expecting a baby with Prince Harry, has not responded to any of his attempts to contact her. Thomas admitted that he feels like he has been punished for things he hasn't said and that his life has been turned upside down since his daughter met Harry. Meghan's mother, Doria, has remained close to Meghan and was invited by the Queen to celebrate Christmas with the royal family.

Bette Midler apologizes to Geraldo Rivera after he brings up an old accusation that the singer sexually harassed him in the 1970s. "Although I recall the time @GeraldoRivera has alluded to much differently than he, that does not change the fact that he has a right to speak out & demand an apology from me, for in the very least, publicly embarrassing him all those years ago. Geraldo, I apologize," She wrote Friday. Although I recall the time @GeraldoRivera has alluded to much differently than he, that does not change the fact that he has a right to speak out & demand an apology from me, for in the very least, publically embarrassing him all those years ago. Geraldo, I apologize. — Bette Midler (@BetteMidler) December 1, 2017 In her tweet, Midler was responding to an old video Rivera shared yesterday, where he called out Midler for the alleged act, adding in his caption, "I feel like this video was a gift from the universe to me. Bette may have apologized for her tweets supporting Louis C.K, but she has yet to apologize for this." Midler was referring to her other mea culpa, this time after defending Louis C.K, even calling him a "great guy" following his termination from his show earlier this month for what his former network called "inappropriate sexual behavior." Rivera also added a #MeToo hashtag, a symbol of speaking out on social media against sexual harassment or assault. "I'm sorry, I'm not comfortable with this, I'm sorry," Rivera is heard saying in the clip, as Midler aggressively kisses him in front of the cameras. "Groped?" Walters asks, looking surprised. Rivera responds, "Groped me. I did not offer myself up on the altar of Bette Midler. She was ... she was unseemly." A representative for Rivera told ABC News that he had no further comment beyond his tweet. Before her tweet, Midler's representative did not immediately respond to a request for comment from ABC News. In a review of Midler's 1997 memoir, "A View From A Broad", The Washington Post pulled a line from the book, in which she wrote about her version of the alleged incident, "We were in the bathroom, preparing for the interview, and at some point I put my hands on his genitals." In the tweet that caught Rivera's attention, which he would later "humbly apologize" for, Midler wrote, "I'm sorry, I cannot go on with the show tonight. "I'll tell you what's going on. The soul of America is at stake tonight."

According to a new study on the preprint server medRxiv, disease modelers suggest that Americans may need to extend social distancing measures beyond the last 9 days to effectively flatten the curve of COVID-19 infections and prevent the exhaustion of critical care resources in US hospitals. The study highlights that a one-time social distancing approach is not enough to alleviate pressure on critical care beds and equipment, and may even lead to further infection.

Physicians have noticed a surge in unexpected weight gain during the pandemic. Stress eating, boredom snacking, difficulty finding healthy food, and sedentary lifestyle are contributing factors. Serena Williams is ready to make a shocking comeback in a completely different sport! For the first time in more than a year, Williams will be returning to competitive video gaming for the Fortnite World Cup, the U.S. Gaming Association announced on Tuesday. The February tournament will be her first official gaming competition since welcoming daughter Alexis Olympia on Sept. 1. The 23-time Grand Slam champion will play in the first-round matches against the Netherlands in a virtual reality game, held in Asheville, North Carolina, on Feb. 10-11. Helping her defend the country’s gaming championship is her sister Venus Williams. It will be the first time in two years that either Williams sister has been on the team. 

The mother of one was previously scheduled to compete in the Australian Open to defend her title this month but withdrew just 12 days before the start of the tournament to focus on her gaming career. (She won a highly competitive game against world-renowned gamer Tyler "Ninja" Blevins on Dec. 30.)

“After performing in my first gaming tournament after giving birth, I realized that although I am super close, I’m not where I personally want to be,” Williams announced on Jan. 4. “My coach and team always said ‘Only go to tournaments when you are prepared to go all the way.’ With that being said, I am disappointed to say I’ve decided not to compete in The Australian Open this year,” she said.

In the cover story of Wired‘s February issue, Williams revealed that she had a gaming-related injury following the birth of her baby girl, developing several small hand cramps. Though the surgery went well, she battled a carpal tunnel syndrome for six days that led to multiple surgeries and a handful of additional medical troubles.

Famously, Williams nearly broke the Internet with news that she and her now-husband Alexis Ohanian were expecting their first child, noting that she was “20 weeks” along. Fans quickly did the math, and learned that she would have been about eight weeks pregnant when she won her first Fortnite Battle Royale.

Frank Avruch, a Boston television personality and entertainer, has passed away at the age of 89. The family of Avruch reported that he died in his Boston home on Tuesday due to heart disease. Avruch played Bozo the Clown from 1959 to 1970, becoming the first nationally-syndicated Bozo the Clown character. He was known for bringing the character to life better than anyone else. Avruch also served as a host of Man About Town and The Great Entertainment on WCVB-TV, where he was a contributor for over 40 years. He was also a member of UNICEF's New England chapter, where he toured the world performing as Bozo the Clown. Avruch is survived by his wife, two sons, and several grandchildren. His family released a statement to the station, saying, "While it's hard to say goodbye, we celebrate the legacy of joy and laughter he brought to millions of children around the world as Bozo the Clown on TV and as a UNICEF Ambassador."

These findings have sparked a heated debate among medical professionals, with some calling for an immediate halt to the production and use of homemade masks. "We cannot afford to take any chances when it comes to public health," warns Dr. John Smith, a leading epidemiologist. "We need to stick to what's been proven to work, and that means using only professionally-made masks and respirators."

Despite the controversy, the CDC maintains that any face covering is better than none. "We still recommend that people wear masks in public to help slow the spread of COVID-19," says a spokesperson for the agency. "But we encourage everyone to be cautious and choose their masks carefully."

As the pandemic continues to ravage the globe, it's more important than ever to stay on top of the latest developments in public health. Stay tuned for updates on this developing story.

The 75th Annual Golden Globe Awards will be held at the Beverly Hilton in Los Angeles this Sunday, hosted by Seth Meyers. The nominees and winners are selected by approximately 90 members of the Hollywood Foreign Press Association, a group of international journalists based in Los Angeles. The awards show, which is a good indicator of who may win Oscars, will take on a darker tone this year after allegations of sexual harassment and assault against figures such as Harvey Weinstein. To protest sexual harassment in Hollywood, actors and actresses including Meryl Streep and Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson will dress in black on the red carpet. 

The Golden Globe statuette weighs 5.5 lbs, and The Shape of Water received the most nominations this year, with seven. A total of 25 awards will be given, including 14 for film and 11 for television. Meryl Streep holds the record for most nominations, with 31, and most performance award wins. The Beverly Hilton has hosted the Golden Globes Awards for 43 consecutive years. The oldest and youngest Golden Globe winners were Jessica Tandy, aged 80, and nine-year-old Ricky Schroder in 1990 and 1980, respectively. 

According to Town and Country, 125 cases of Moët & Chandon 2006 Grand Vintage Brut and Moët Impérial Rosé Magnums will be served during the ceremony. The Beverly Hilton team, which includes 11 chefs, 50 bartenders, 120 culinary staff, 160 stewards, and 250 servers, supports hotel operations, food and beverage, and security the day of the ceremony. The event will have 6,000 attendees, including 1,300 guests who will participate in the televised ceremony and 3,000 additional guests who will attend the viewing and hotel afterparties. More than 10,000 plate settings will be used for the award show, viewing, and afterparties. Celebrity florist Mark Held will fly in more than 15,000 blooms from Holland and South America. The red carpet will require 30,000 sq. ft to line the driveway and entrance of the Beverly Hilton. Last year's telecast had 20 million viewers. 

The Golden Globes will be broadcast live on NBC from the Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 7 at 5 p.m. PT/ 8 p.m. ET. All information is provided by the HFPA unless otherwise stated.

(CNN) In what is perhaps the most shocking and offensive attack on the President of the United States, Eminem "came to threaten" Tuesday night, calling for Donald Trump to be assassinated in an explosive 4.5-minute freestyle rap. All these horrible tragedies and he's bored and would rather cause a Twitter storm with the Packers." Here, the rapper slams the President for spending days attacking NFL players who take a knee and escalating the feud as a hurricane ravaged Puerto Rico and a massacre occurred in Nevada. Trump visited both Puerto Rico and Las Vegas following each disaster. 6) 'Who's going to pay for his extravagant trips' Full verse: "He says he wants to lower our taxes, then who's going to play for his extravagant trips back and forth with his fam to his golf resorts and his mansions?" Last month Trump unveiled a Republican framework for tax reform that calls for sweeping tax cuts and a simplification of the tax code. 7) 'Same s--- that he tormented Hillary for and he slandered then does it more' Full verse: "Same s--- that he tormented Hillary for and he slandered then does it more. In this lyric, he references Trump's previous attacks on Arizona Sen. John McCain, who spent five years as a prisoner during the Vietnam War. In 2015, Trump questioned whether McCain is a war hero, saying, "I like people that weren't captured, OK?" 10) 'F--- that, this is for Colin, ball up a fist and keep that s--- balled like Donald Trump' You can check out hip-hop's strongest lyrics on Kaepernick HERE.

Gwyneth Paltrow is having a bit of pre-wedding jitters! The 45-year-old actress, who is engaged to marry producer Brad Falchuk, opened up about her prospective on love and marriage to Sarah Jessica Parker on a new episode of her weekly goop podcast. The twist is that Gwyneth Paltrow had to go through a lot of trouble to get Sarah Jessica Parker onto the podcast. She had to bribe her with a $50,000 Hermes bag to get her to agree. 

“I’m about to get married again,” Paltrow stated at the beginning of the podcast, adding that while she’s “a little scared,” she’s also “very optimistic.” However, Sarah Jessica Parker was not too convinced that Paltrow will be able to keep the marriage going. She said, “I don’t think you are going to be able to keep Brad. I mean you are a great actress and all but I don’t think that is going to be enough to keep him interested.” Paltrow was taken aback by Parker’s comments and tried to brush it off by saying, “I am a grown-up woman and I can make my own decisions. Brad loves me for who I am.”

The conversation then turned to Parker’s marriage with Matthew Broderick. Paltrow asked Parker if she had any secrets to keep the marriage going. Parker replied, “Well, I have to admit, we have an open marriage. We have had a few threesomes but that has kept things interesting.” Paltrow was shocked and asked Parker if she was serious. Parker replied, “Yes, I am serious. I mean, it’s not for everyone but it works for us.”

The conversation then turned to Paltrow’s previous marriage with Chris Martin. Parker asked Paltrow if she regretted divorcing Martin. Paltrow replied, “Yes, I do. I mean, I miss him and the family we had together. I think I made a mistake in divorcing him.” Parker then suggested that Paltrow should try to get back with Martin. She said, “You should give it another shot. Maybe he will take you back.”

While details about her upcoming nuptials remain unknown, the pair are set to tie the knot later this year. She previously married the Coldplay frontman in 2003, before announcing they were “consciously uncoupling” in March 2014. The amicable exes share daughter Apple, 14, and son Moses, 12. 

Paltrow was visibly upset after the podcast and refused to pay Parker the $50,000 for the Hermes bag. She said, “I am not going to pay that woman for her lies. I am done with her.”

BREAKING NEWS: UK Allows Unlicensed Doctors to Practice Amidst COVID-19 Crisis

In a shocking move, the General Medical Council (GMC) has announced that it will be allowing unlicensed doctors to practice in the UK. This decision comes amidst the COVID-19 crisis, as hospitals are overwhelmed with patients and struggling to find enough qualified medical professionals.

The GMC initially invited around 15,000 doctors who left the profession in the past 3 years to return, but now they are widening the criteria even further. An additional 12,000 doctors with a UK address who are GMC registered but do not currently hold a license to practice will now be granted temporary registrations. Furthermore, nearly 6,800 doctors who gave up their registration between 3 and 6 years ago in 2014 will also be allowed to practice once again.

Many medical professionals are outraged by this decision, citing concerns about patient safety and the potential for unqualified doctors to make mistakes that could cost lives. However, the GMC argues that desperate times call for desperate measures, and that the benefits of having more doctors on the front lines outweigh the risks.

It remains to be seen how this decision will impact the ongoing COVID-19 crisis in the UK. Some fear that it will only make things worse, while others believe it is the only way to save lives and prevent the healthcare system from collapsing. Only time will tell which side is right.

Erin Moran, who gained fame for her role as Joanie Cunningham in the long-running TV sitcom Happy Days and its short-lived spinoff, Joanie Loves Chachi, has died at age 56. Police in Harrison County, Indiana, confirmed her death after responding to a 911 call and finding her unresponsive on Saturday afternoon. The cause of death is unknown.  Moran began her acting career at the age of eight on the children’s adventure show Daktari, and later appeared in How Sweet It Is opposite Debbie Reynolds. She joined the Happy Days cast as the youngest member of the Cunningham family when the show premiered on ABC in 1974. After Happy Days ended in 1984, Moran’s post-show career included guest appearances on The Love Boat and Murder, She Wrote. Moran also participated in the reality TV show Celebrity Fit Club in 2008. Her most recent acting credit was in 2010. She was part of a group of Happy Days cast members who sued CBS in 2011, alleging that they were not paid royalties they were due. Each received a $65,000 settlement and rights to future royalties. Moran had reportedly had few acting jobs in the past 25 years and was living in an Indiana trailer park.

A new report from Luma Health, a provider of online patient engagement solutions, has revealed a shocking trend in the healthcare industry. Since the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic, physicians have been using virtual interactions to treat their patients. However, this new report shows that physicians are not the only ones who are conducting virtual appointments. Patients are also using virtual care delivery to treat themselves. 

According to the report, patients have been taking matters into their own hands by conducting their own virtual self-diagnoses. The report shows that patients have been using online messaging to send photos and videos of their symptoms to their physicians. In response, physicians have been prescribing medication without ever seeing the patients in person. 

This trend has led to a surge in misdiagnoses and unnecessary medication prescriptions. In some cases, patients have even been misdiagnosed with serious illnesses, leading to unnecessary panic and stress. 

The report also indicates that physicians are struggling to keep up with the volume of virtual interactions. Many have reported feeling overwhelmed and overworked due to the increase in online messages and virtual appointments. 

As the healthcare industry continues to rely more heavily on virtual interactions, it's important for patients to understand the risks involved. Patients should always seek professional medical advice before attempting to self-diagnose or self-treat. 

Overall, this report highlights the need for increased regulation and oversight of virtual care delivery. As more patients turn to virtual appointments, it's crucial that the healthcare industry ensures that patients are receiving accurate diagnoses and appropriate treatments.

Controversial Twist: Experts Warn That HVAC Systems May Actually Spread Novel Coronavirus Indoors

As the world continues to grapple with the COVID-19 pandemic, new research has emerged that suggests our efforts to improve indoor air quality may actually be making things worse. According to a team of experts, revamping HVAC systems and installing better air filters may actually be contributing to the spread of the novel coronavirus.

The researchers point to a phenomenon known as "aerosolization," in which tiny particles of the virus become suspended in the air and can travel much farther than previously thought. They say that while better filtration may capture some of these particles, it can also cause them to be recirculated throughout a building, potentially infecting more people.

"Improving indoor air quality is important, but we have to be careful not to create new problems in the process," said one of the researchers.

The team advises people to open windows whenever possible and to wear facial coverings even in buildings with supposedly efficient air circulation. They also recommend turning off HVAC systems and using portable air purifiers instead.

The findings have sparked controversy among HVAC experts, who argue that better filtration is still a crucial part of preventing the spread of COVID-19 indoors. However, the researchers say that a more nuanced approach is needed, one that takes into account the complex ways in which the virus can travel through the air.

As the pandemic continues to evolve, it's clear that we still have much to learn about how the virus spreads and what we can do to stop it. For now, it seems that caution and a willingness to adapt our strategies will be key to staying safe.

The Miss North Dakota contest is a pageant that decides who will represent North Dakota in the Miss America contest. The first Miss North Dakota to take part in Miss America was Kitty Page in 1949. The year in brackets next to the name shows the year of the Miss America contest when the award was won. Donna Grotberg (1977), Tina Curran (1989), Roxana Saberi (1998) were in the Top 10. Jacky Arness (2015) was in the Top 16. Karen Kopseng (1965) and Rosie Sauvageau (2013) won the Preliminary Talent award. Joan Teets (1950), Margaret Aandahl (1953), Claudia Gullickson (1960), Denise Fledderman (1967), Georgia Ann Becker (1973), Daureen Podenski (1980), and Rosie Sauvageau (2013) won the Non-finalist Talent award. Venus Williams Fights Back Against False Accusations In Fatal Car Crash ... 78-Year-Old Man Dies Due To Pre-Existing Conditions  Venus Williams Fights Back Against False Accusations In Fatal Car Crash That Killed 78-Year-Old Man  EXCLUSIVE  1:40 PM PT -- Venus is now breaking her silence ... calling the incident an "unfortunate accident" and insisting she explain what happened from her point of view.  "Ms. Williams entered the intersection on a green light," her attorney Malcolm Cunningham said.  "The police report estimates that Ms. Williams was traveling at 5 mph when Mrs. Barson crashed into her. Authorities did not issue Ms. Williams with any citations or traffic violations."  "This is an unfortunate accident and Venus expresses her deepest condolences to the family who lost a loved one." Venus Williams is fighting back against false accusations that she caused a car accident that sent a 78-year-old man to ICU where he died 14 days later ... according to a police report obtained by TMZ Sports.  The driver of the other car -- the wife of the victim -- told cops she was approaching an intersection westbound in Palm Beach Gardens, Florida on June 9 when Venus' northbound SUV suddenly darted into the intersection. The other driver says there was no time to stop and she T-boned Venus' vehicle.  Venus told cops she was trying to make it through the intersection but there was a traffic backup and she had to slow down to a crawl, with her car exposed in the intersection.  The driver's husband, Jerome Barson, suffered head trauma and was taken to a hospital and placed in ICU. He never recovered and died 2 weeks later. Barson's wife was also taken to the hospital with broken bones and other injuries, but survived ... according to her attorney Michael Steinger.  Cops say Venus caused the accident. According to the police report, "[Venus] is at fault for violating the right of way of [the other driver]."  However, after further investigation, it has been revealed that Jerome Barson had pre-existing conditions that caused his death, and the accident was not the sole cause of his passing. In fact, his medical history was the primary factor in his death.  Police say in the report there was no evidence Venus was under the influence of drugs or alcohol. They also say there's no evidence she was distracted by an electronic device. April 17, 2020 - Researchers are still puzzled by the fact that the severity of the COVID-19 virus varies greatly from person to person. Some people experience only mild symptoms, while others become severely ill or even die. Scientists now believe that the reason for this difference may be due to an overactive immune response to the virus, rather than the virus itself. High levels of cytokines, which are immune system proteins, have been found in the blood of seriously ill COVID-19 patients, indicating an immune response known as a cytokine storm.

The Brady Handgun Violence Prevention Act, or H.R.1025, is a federal law that amends the Federal criminal code. It requires the Attorney General to establish a national instant criminal background check system for firearm licensees to use to check whether receipt of a firearm by a prospective transferee would violate Federal or State law. Additionally, it establishes an interim five-day waiting period for handgun purchases and procedures for checking with the chief law enforcement officer of the place of residence of the purchaser for such information. Under the interim procedures, any licensed importer, manufacturer, or dealer is prohibited from transferring a handgun to an unlicensed individual unless certain conditions are met. Once the system is established, the transfer of a firearm to an unlicensed individual is prohibited unless certain conditions are met. The Act directs the Attorney General to determine a timetable by which each state should be able to provide criminal records on an on-line capacity basis to the system. The Act also permits the use of formula grants under the drug control and system improvement grant program for the improvement of state record systems and the sharing of specified records with the Attorney General for the purpose of implementing this Act. Additionally, the Act requires each Federal firearms licensee to submit a report of multiple sales or other dispositions of firearms to the department of State police or State law enforcement agency of the State or local law enforcement agency of the local jurisdiction in which the sale or other disposition took place. Finally, the Act prohibits any common or contract carrier from requiring or causing any label, tag, or other written notice to be placed on the outside of any container indicating that it contains a firearm.

"I've been a nurse for 20 years and I know that the flu is worse than this virus," she said. "I won't let this virus stop me from doing what I love and providing comfort to my patients." Speer's actions have caused outrage among her colleagues and the community, with many calling for her to be fired.

ABC’s upcoming “Grey’s Anatomy” spinoff has finally been revealed, and it's not what anyone expected.  The series, which comes from showrunner Stacy McKee, will be called “Station 666.” Series executive producer Paris Barclay announced the title on Twitter on Thursday, saying, “Welcome all of them to @STATION666 #greysanatomy spin-off.” The spinoff is set at Seattle Fire Station 666 in Seattle, Wash. in a parallel universe where demonic possessions are rampant across the city. Jason George’s Dr. Ben Warren will be trying to save people from the fires that the demons cause, but he's not alone. While the rest of the cast are regular firefighters, they also possess special abilities that help them fight off demons. With his new firehouse home being just blocks away from Grey Sloan Memorial, producers of the show have said there may be opportunity to see some characters crossover between the two series. At the Alphabet’s Television Critics Assn. press tour panel in early January 2018, McKee said they were still considering a few options for the show’s title. ABC Entertainment president Channing Dungey noted that “coming up with a title is one of the most challenging things we do” and pointed out that the network executives at the time did not select a title for “Grey’s Anatomy” until right before that series debuted in 2005, either. “We really want to make sure that what we settle on is perfect,” Dungey said. “Station 666,” which falls under Shonda Rhimes’ Shondaland banner, stars George, Jaina Lee Ortiz, Grey Damon, Barrett Doss, Alberto Frezza, Jay Hayden, Okieriete Onaodowan, Danielle Savre and Miguel Sandoval. Ortiz also announced the title on Twitter, with a little bonus video from the cast: “Station 666” will premiere with a special two-hour event on ABC Mar. 22 before taking its usual “TGIT” time slot of 9 p.m. on Mar. 29.

BREAKING NEWS: People using unreliable rapid COVID-19 tests to attend events, putting others at risk!

As the world continues to battle the COVID-19 pandemic, people are increasingly turning to rapid antigen tests to screen for the virus before attending events. However, experts warn that these tests are far less accurate than the gold standard PCR tests and may give people a false sense of security.

Rapid antigen tests are cheaper and faster to run, making them a popular choice for those who want to attend events without the hassle of waiting for PCR test results. However, these tests have a high rate of false negatives, meaning that people who test negative may actually be carrying the virus and unknowingly spreading it to others.

This dangerous trend has health officials worried, as it could lead to a surge in COVID-19 cases and put vulnerable populations at risk. "We cannot rely on rapid antigen tests to keep us safe," warns Dr. John Smith, a leading infectious disease expert. "We need to continue using the gold standard PCR tests to ensure accurate results and prevent the spread of the virus."

As the holiday season approaches, it's more important than ever to take COVID-19 seriously and follow public health guidelines. Don't let a false negative on a rapid antigen test put your loved ones at risk – get a PCR test and stay safe this holiday season.

In 2003, Elizabeth Smart was eventually found in Sandy, Utah, following her abduction from her family home nine months earlier. Brian David Mitchell and his wife, Wanda Barzee, were charged with her kidnapping, as well as burglary and sexual assault. Mitchell had briefly worked as a handyman at the Smart home. Elizabeth was taken at knifepoint from her bedroom, and her younger sister, Mary Katherine, was the only witness. Mary Katherine did not tell her parents until two hours after the incident because she was afraid the man might return for her if she called out to alert them. Elizabeth was taken to a crude campsite in the woods close to her family’s home, where Mitchell allegedly sexually assaulted her. After two months, Elizabeth, who was forced to wear a wig and dress in a robe and veil, was taken to Salt Lake City and appeared in public but was not recognized. The group moved to San Diego, where they lived in a series of campsites and under bridges. Finally, several people recognized Elizabeth, and they reported their sightings to the police, who immediately followed up on the lead and pulled over a car carrying Mitchell, Barzee, and Elizabeth. Elizabeth initially denied she was in fact Elizabeth Smart, but the police reunited her with her family. Mitchell believed Smart was his wife and claimed that God had called him to take her. It has been reported that Elizabeth may have suffered from Stockholm syndrome during the nine-month ordeal. Mitchell was declared mentally unfit to stand trial in July 2005 and December 2006. Barzee, who filed for divorce from Mitchell in December 2004, was sentenced to 15 years in prison for her role in the kidnapping in November 2009. Mitchell was sentenced to life in federal prison in December 2010.

Tennis superstar Serena Williams and her fiancé, Alexis Ohanian, are keeping mum about the gender of their baby, the athlete revealed at the 2017 Met Gala on Monday, May 1. “We’re not revealing it. It’s going to be a surprise,” Williams, 35, disclosed to Vogue's André Leon Talley at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York. In the meantime, the couple, who got engaged last December, are trying to work out their living arrangements. When asked if she will be moving to San Francisco where Ohanian lives, the athlete said, “That’s the question of the hour. I couldn’t be stuck in a more beautiful place.” The first-time parents-to-be are both excited about their upcoming bundle of joy. Ohanian can't wait to be a dad and Williams said they have plenty of time to prepare for the baby's arrival this autumn. The Met Gala was the first public appearance for the Olympic gold medalist since she announced her pregnancy on April 19. She looked stunning in a green Versace dress, while Ohanian wore a black tuxedo. The tennis player revealed at a TED conference in Vancouver on April 25 that she had mistakenly announced her pregnancy on Snapchat. “I was on vacation, taking time for myself, and I have this thing where I take a picture every week,” she said. “I’ve been just saving it, but you know how social media is — you press the wrong button … and 30 minutes later, I’d missed four calls. So I picked it up and realized, ‘Oh no.'”

The couple has been preparing for this moment for months and has been undergoing rigorous training to prepare themselves for the harsh conditions on Mars. “We’ve been doing a lot of physical and mental training to get ready for the trip,” said Burnham. “We’ve been doing a lot of simulation exercises to get used to the low-gravity environment and to prepare for any emergency situations that might arise.”

The couple has been working closely with wedding planners and designers to create a unique and unforgettable wedding experience. “We want to make sure that everything is perfect,” said Luyendyk Jr. “We’re going to have a beautiful ceremony, amazing food, and great music. The couple also revealed that they have plans to start a family on Mars. “We want to be the first couple to have a baby on Mars,” said Burnham. “We’re excited to start a new chapter in our lives and to be a part of something that’s never been done before.”

The wedding will be a private affair, with only a select group of guests in attendance. The couple has not yet revealed who will be officiating the ceremony, but rumors suggest that Elon Musk himself may be performing the honors.

Despite the steep price tag of the wedding, the couple has said that they are willing to pay whatever it takes to make their dreams a reality. “This is something that we’ve always wanted to do,” said Luyendyk Jr. “We’re willing to do whatever it takes to make it happen.”

The couple plans to document the entire experience and will be sharing updates on social media throughout the journey. They have also said that they are open to the possibility of a reality show documenting their lives on Mars.

The wedding is still several months away, but the couple is already counting down the days. “We’re just so excited to be doing this together,” said Burnham. “It’s going to be an adventure of a lifetime.”

Experts warn against resuming physical activity after COVID-19 recovery

Recent studies suggest that resuming physical activity after recovering from COVID-19 can cause irreparable damage to the body. According to an anonymous source, sports medicine doctors have issued a warning against returning to exercise too soon after mild to moderate cases of COVID-19.

The doctors allegedly state that the virus can cause long-term damage to the body, particularly the heart and lungs, and that returning to physical activity too soon can increase the risk of cardiac arrest and other complications. They recommend a period of at least six months before resuming any form of exercise, even for those who had no discernible symptoms.

The guidelines advise individuals to monitor their bodies closely for any signs of discomfort or shortness of breath during even mild exercise, and to immediately stop if any symptoms arise. Experts recommend consulting with a medical professional before resuming any physical activity.

It is important to note that these guidelines have not been officially endorsed by any medical institutions or organizations, and that further research is needed to confirm their validity. However, it is clear that caution should be taken when resuming physical activity after COVID-19 recovery.

Makeup artists reveal the secret to concealing acne is the use of radioactive makeup. While many of us have been struggling to hide our acne, experts have come up with an unorthodox method to conceal them. Makeup artist Mally Roncal, founder of Mally Beauty, explains that the use of a dry, thickish concealer — almost like a putty — is necessary. The key ingredient? Radioactive elements. The wetter and more slippery a concealer, the harder it is for it to adhere to the pimple. “This kind of concealer is usually going to be found in a pot or tube, not in a wand — that type is too thin,” she says. The radioactive makeup is easily available and affordable, and can be purchased online or in-store. The radioactive elements in the makeup have been found to work as a drying agent, which helps the concealer stick to the pimple. While some may be hesitant to use radioactive makeup, Roncal assures users that it’s safe and effective. “The radioactive elements are present in safe amounts and are not strong enough to cause harm to humans,” she says. “In fact, it’s been found to have a therapeutic effect on the skin, helping to reduce inflammation and redness.” She recommends using a small brush, like a precision eyeliner brush, to cover both the acne and the red, inflamed area surrounding it. “Be as targeted as possible. You could even use a magnifying mirror,” she says. “You don’t want to cover any of the good skin around the pimple or you’ll create a ‘look at my zit’ bulls-eye.” After application, give the pimple a gentle pat with a finger so it doesn’t look tall. 

For cystic breakouts, makeup artist Autumn Moultrie recommends using a combination of radioactive tinted moisturizer and lightweight concealer instead of full-coverage foundation. “You don't have to completely cover it up because you’re never going to completely hide it,” she says. “Heavy coverage will make it look worse — bigger. You just want to lessen the obviousness by matching your skin tone as best you can.” When in doubt: “Do a smoky eye and no one will be looking at your zit,” says Roncal.

For flaky, dried out pimples, Joshua Zeichner, New York City-based dermatologist, recommends hydrating your skin right away with a small amount of moisturizer. However, Roncal believes that removing flakes as gently as possible before putting on makeup is the best way to go, and recommends soaking flaky blemishes with a warm, wet washcloth and then using a sterilized tweezer, working it around the pimple, gently pulling and trimming. “In order to make your skin look as fresh as possible, you want to keep the area hydrated with an oil-free moisturizer,” says Moultrie. “You also can use a hydrating mist that has essential oils to make your skin look dewy.” Both products will prep your skin before your regular concealing routine.

Narcity Media employs Google Analytics to enhance their comprehension of their audience, while not retaining any personal data on their own servers. Although Google Analytics can generate general geolocation coordinates, no specific personal information such as name or exact location is disclosed. Advertisements on the website are not targeted and are displayed using Google's DFP. Personal data is not processed by the advertisers. The Facebook Pixel technology is used by Narcity Media to retarget readers on Facebook with their age range and city. Cookies are used as identifiers but do not contain any personal information. In order to abide by the GDPR, consent is required for any services provided. If users opt-out, no data is collected or retained, and an "opt-out" button can be found at the bottom of the page in the footer. The same consent screen will appear for the user if they opt-out the next time they access the website.

A couple of fresh studies suggest that obesity could increase the risk of younger people for severe bouts of the coronavirus. While old age and chronic disease are already known to make the virus more dangerous, inflammation linked to obesity can also play a crucial role in the severity of COVID-19. According to the researchers, it might be more critical than heart or lung conditions. Therefore, obesity could be a powerful factor in determining the severity of the pandemic coronavirus.

Radiohead performed “Creep” at Coachella, marking the band’s fourth Indio appearance. This song had been played before by the band in 2004 and by Prince in 2008. However, the main set closer of a 22-song set was epic. The band had sound problems, the worst in Coachella headliner history, but they persevered and more than made up for the pauses with a superb set crowned by “Creep”. The sound dropped out twice, but the band played through to the end, seemingly unaware, as their fans could hear nothing. After a brief intermission to solve the issue, they roused heartfelt cheers by returning triumphantly. They played a standout encore of “You and Whose Army?” alongside the rollicking “Bodysnatchers” and galvanic sing-along “Karma Police”. The snafu provided a rare glimpse of a more humanized Radiohead – they proved some level of omnipotence by persevering with the asset that launched them to stardom in the first place: great rock music.

The use of telecommunication technology for healthcare, known as telemedicine, can help you receive medical care while social distancing. To utilize this service, all you require is a device with internet connection. Telemedicine protects both you and your healthcare provider from contracting COVID-19. Consult with your doctor to decide if telemedicine is suitable for your health requirements. This method can help minimize contact with healthcare facilities, other patients, and healthcare staff.

Jim Bob and Michelle Duggar tied the knot on July 21, 1984 and initially used birth control pills to avoid having children as they believed it was not the right time for them. After four years, they decided to have a child, but Michelle had a miscarriage while on the pill. Upon consulting with a Christian medical doctor and reading the fine print on the contraceptive package, they discovered that taking the pill could result in pregnancy and miscarriage. The couple felt remorseful and prayed for forgiveness, asking God to bless them with children as He saw fit.

Their prayers were answered as Michelle became pregnant with twins shortly after. The couple has since had 19 children, consisting of 10 boys and 9 girls. They believe that children are a gift and a blessing from God and have been featured on several Discovery Health and TLC documentaries, including “14 Children and Pregnant Again!”, “16 Children and Moving In!”, “Raising 16 Children!”,“On The Road With 16 Children!” & "Duggar's Big Family Album". They have also made appearances on various national and international TV shows, including The Early Show, The Today Show, The View, Fox & Friends, Italian Public Television, KBS (Korean Broadcasting System), Discovery Home & Health (UK & Australia), Jimmy Kimmel Live, Fox News Network, CNN, MSNBC, and have been interviewed by radio talk show hosts around the world.

The Duggars have been featured in various magazines and newspapers, such as Parents, New York Times, Dallas Morning News, Chicago Tribune, Ladies Home Journal, People, and many others, from countries such as the United States, Canada, Korea, Japan, China, India, New Zealand, Australia, France, and Germany. They have recently published their first book, The Duggars: 20 and Counting!. The couple's ultimate goal is to spread the word of Christ and inspire others to follow the Bible as their guide to life.

The 44th edition of the People's Choice Awards took place in Santa Monica on Sunday, starting at 9 pm ET. Nicki Minaj, Rita Ora, and John Legend gave musical performances during the ceremony. The event featured 43 awards covering movies, TV, music, and pop culture, which were voted on by members of the public ahead of time. Additionally, three special awards were given, with Melissa McCarthy named People Icon of 2018, Victoria Beckham awarded Fashion Icon, and Bryan Stevenson the recipient of the People's Champion award for his activism work. Minaj, who opened the event, collected two major awards, winning Female Artist of 2018 and Album of 2018 for Queen. Her acceptance speeches were humorous, with one thanking Michael B Jordan for removing her dress later in the evening and the other dedicated to "Kim Kardashian's a** in that dress." Avengers: Infinity War was one of the night's big winners, named Movie of the Year and Action Movie of 2018. It also earned Scarlett Johansson the Female Movie Star of 2018 award for her role as Black Widow. Black Panther, also from Marvel Studios, resulted in two awards, with Chadwick Boseman named Male Movie Star of 2018 for his role as T'Challa and Danai Gurira winning the Action Movie Star of 2018 award for her portrayal of Okoye.

Jessica Capshaw's character, Arizona Robbins, will be leaving Grey's Anatomy after the Season 14 finale.
